I also worked with XXXX  to rectify this error by providing them supporting documentation from Macys but as per XXXX  they have not received any updated information from macys to remove deliquency. I have been thrown in circles by both of these companies- XXXX   and macys credit reporting department. Macys, on each call has confirmed that from their end the account is current and has never been late however XXXX  is still reporting the account as 30 days past due in XX/XX/2020. 
XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX - report number XXXX, corrected the information but on XX/XX/XXXX - report number XXXX again published incorrect information. 

This is a pure example of missing links in the process which macys uses to update and make changes to credit bureau reporting as well as inefficiencies of credit bureau to be able to accurately verify and update information. I am not sure which company 's process is broken but I am victim of this broken dysfunctional process which has negatively affected me and is hindering me from moving forward with my home buying process. I would like to request XXXX  to remove 30 day delinquency attached to my macys credit account and also appropriately update my score back. The day delinquency was posted, my score dropped by 21 points and I am hoping that it will be reverted. Looking forward to a resolve, I will be happy to provide any supporting documentation needed. Thanks

I stated Citibank removed the option to order it online. And I further told him dispute notifications had also vanished, although I managed to download some of them before it happened.

On XX/XX/2020, I called Citibanks 800 number. I talked to XXXX. I asked XXXX for a copy of my card member agreement electronically and by mail. Consumer complaint narrative:
I called Citi on XX/XX/2020 for my Premiere Card, considering to close it. The Rep persuaded me to switch to Reward Card, and I can transfer my approximate XXXX points to the new card. 

I told the Rep that I would to use the points to book a flight very soon, and I can use the 25 % extra travel bonus for purchasing the flight, I want to make sure that I do not lose it by transferring it. I emphasized it that I do not want to lose it, so the Rep put me on hold to double check it, coming back to reassure me that as long as I use it in 14 days, the 25 % travel bonus will still apply. With that promise to me, she switched it using the same credit card account number. 

On XX/XX/2020, I wanted to book the flight, I was surprised to find that I lost the 25 % travel bonus by switching it. I started calling/live chat Citi, every time I called them, I had to repeat the same story, and then being transferred here and there. I started faxing Citi letters and proofs. I told them that the phone conversation was recorded on XX/XX/20 ' ( XXXX XXXX  PST for 41 minutes ), the Rep misled me, I wanted Citi to fix it. 

I may lose more or all benefit with time restriction, and I need to book the flight now, I asked if they can call/email/fax me their responses, but they only sent me letters, which usually took a week. They would not even faxed me the letter before mailing out. 
Per their request, I had recently faxed them the Premiere Card 's Directory of Service to show the 25 % travel bonus and a statement with my name on it. I got the response today basically saying that nothing was wrong, if I still have the dispute, call them! 

So more than a month had passed, I still could not resolve the dispute. I started wondering if Citi wants to delay it until I lose all points? If I exceed the time restriction not using the points, I could forfeit all points. Citi never mentioned the recorded phone conversation in their response to me, even if I asked them to listen to it more than once ; so, the recording is only used it in their favor? when it is not, then just ignore it?

After I returned the money, my checking account reflected the normal amount before the check had been deposited. Thursday the XXXX I went to buy food and my debit card was declined. On Friday XX/XX/XXXX, my direct deposit from work came in and my account was still negative. I called Citibank and they notified me that I would be responsible for the fraudulent funds I transferred out and that they are not responsible for any checks deposited. I argued that I did not know that the check was fraudulent and that the funds cleared in my account. Furthermore, I would not have authorized the transfers through XXXX/XXXX  had I known that the funds were fraudulent. I spoke to several supervisors and they all told me that because I authorized the transfers from my account that I was solely responsible for the fraud and that they would not be able to credit my account for the stolen funds. They said that the check was cleared at first in good faith, and only after the return transfers were made was when the check was flagged as stolen. I am left to assume the risk and liability of the entire thing. I filed a police report and also contacted the federal trade commission.

They would not tell me what the problem was, so I agreed to receive the verification. I waited for about one week and had not received anything, so I decided to try to register again and received the same results. At this point, my payment due date XXXX XX/XX/XXXX ) was 2 days away. I was connected to the payment department, and they told me there would be a XXXX-dollar charge for processing my payment. I declined and asked how I could avoid the charge, and they said that they could transfer me to the automated system. I agreed. I spoke to a different person, and they again refused to tell me what the problem with my account was. I also asked to speak to a manager but was told that one was not available. 

This whole process cost me a {$29.00} late fee because I had to mail my payment in, which they received 2 days late. I understand I could've mailed it out sooner, but I was waiting for that verification by mail or email that never arrived.

I applied for the card to take advantage of a new account discount advertised on Home Depot 's website. 
In pertinent part, the website states the following with respect to the subject discount : This offer is redeemable for either a {$25.00} discount on a single-receipt purchase of {$25.00} up to {$290.00}, a {$50.00} discount on a single-receipt purchase of {$300.00} up to {$990.00} or a {$100.00} discount on a single-receipt purchase of {$1000.00} or more within 30 days of your account open date at The Home Depot retail stores or homedepot.com when made with your The Home Depot Consumer Credit Card, The Home Depot Home Improver Card, The Home Depot Commercial Revolving Charge, or The Home Depot Commercial Account. 
On that date, and in reliance upon this representation, I used my new Home Depot consumer credit card to purchase an electric lawnmower ( Mower 1 ) ( order # XXXX in the amount of {$330.00} ). 
Pursuant to the terms of the new account promotion, the promised {$50.00} discount was applied to the purchase. 


XX/XX/XXXX - XX/XX/2020 I took receipt of Mower 1 ( XX/XX/XXXX ) and its battery ( XX/XX/XXXX ), which had been delivered to my local Home Depot ( XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, VA XXXX ). 


XX/XX/2020 - XX/XX/2020 I used Mower 1 several times and, after attempting to troubleshoot the problem, concluded it was defective. 
I decided to return Mower 1 to my local Home Depot. 
I identified a different lawnmower that I wished to purchase ; it was in stock at my local Home Depot ( Mower 2 ) for {$390.00}. 


XX/XX/2020 Given I opened a Home Depot consumer credit card account to avail myself of the {$50.00} discount, I wanted to ensure that Citibank would honor the discount when I exchanged the defective Mower 1 for Mower 2. 
I called Citibank using the Customer Service number on the back of my card and asked if Citibank would apply the {$50.00} discount to my purchase of Mower 2. 
The agent assured me that Citibank would apply the discount to the Mower 2 purchase. 
She instructed me to perform two separate transactions ( rather than a single exchange transaction ) at my local Home Depot to ensure the {$50.00} discount would be properly applied. 
First, she said, I should return Mower 1 so that it would be credited to my account.

Second, she said I should purchase Mower 2 as a separate transaction using my Home Depot consumer credit card. 


XX/XX/2020 In accordance with the Citibank agents instructions, I went to my local Home Depot, where I returned Mower 1 and purchased Mower 2. 
The {$50.00} refund was not applied to the purchase of Mower 2 at the time of purchase, so I decided to monitor my account to ensure Citibank applied it after the fact. 


XX/XX/2020 I checked my account and determined that Citibank had not applied the {$50.00} discount. 
I called Citibank Customer Service and asked the agent about the status of the discount application. 
She informed me that my purchase of Mower 2 was ineligible for the {$50.00} discount because Citibank had applied the discount to the purchase of Mower 1. 
I explained that I had to return Mower 1 because it was defective and that I bought Mower 2 in reliance on the XX/XX/2020 representation of another agent that Citibank would honor the {$50.00} discount in connection with that purchase. 
She stated that the agent with whom I spoke on XX/XX/XXXX had misinformed me and that there was nothing Citibank could do. 
I asked to speak to her manager and was connected to XXXX, a supervisor on the Citibank Escalation Departments Client Advocacy Team. 
XXXX stated that new account holders effectively have one bite of the apple when it comes to the {$50.00} new account discount, Citibank will only apply it to the first purchase, and wont apply it to a second purchase even when, as here, the new account holder returns the item because it is defective. 
She said that the Client Advocacy Team cant deviate from this policy due to marketing regulations. 
My frustration grew over the course of this phone call, and I advised XXXX that I believed Citibank had violated UDAAP given that, to my detriment, I opened this account in reliance on the Home Depot websites representation that I would receive the {$50.00} new account discount and I returned Mower 1 and purchased Mower 2 using my Home Depot consumer credit card because a Citibank agent assured me that Citibank would honor the {$50.00} discount. 
XXXX apologized that an agent had misinformed me but stated there was nothing she could do. 
At my request, she escalated this matter to the Executive Response team ( from which I received an automated email but have had no further communication ).
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX, my AAdvantage account number XXXX ( the " AAdvantage Account '' ) was terminated by XXXX XXXX for suspected " fraud, misrepresentation and/or abuse '' of the AAdvantage program. As a result, over XXXX XXXX XXXX miles -- nearly all of which were earned through Citi 's financial products -- were confiscated by XXXX XXXX. A copy of the " AAdvantage Account Suspension '' letter emailed to me by XXXX XXXX Corporate Security is attached herewith as Exhibit A. 

As mentioned, nearly all miles earned on the AAdvantage Account were accrued through my various financial accounts with Citi between the years XXXX and XXXX. A cursory internet search seems to indicate that XXXX XXXX is actively terminating customers who have earned miles through Citi accounts. Therefore, the purpose of this complaint is to request Citi 's assistance through verification of the miles earned from my various Citi accounts. 

Each of the statements attached as Exhibit B document the various promotional bonuses earned through Citi credit cards since XXXX. Each of these accounts were applied for by me, and duly approved by Citi 's credit card division, between XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX. 

While I recognize that promotional credit card offers publicly presented on websites such as Citi.com and XXXX generally limit participation in such offers to once every 24 or 48 months, the statements in Exhibit B reflect fulfillment of non-public direct solicitations without any such limitations as to frequency. With the exception of the accounts ending in XXXX ( personal card ) and XXXX ( business card ) -- which were applied for using offers publicly available on http : //www.citi.com/ -- all other accounts documented in the statements in Exhibit B were applied for using promotional offers received regularly from Citi and/or XXXX XXXX via direct mail or email between the years XXXX and XXXX. A sample of the direct mail offer terms is attached as Exhibit C, which states only that " [ i ] f you are an existing Citi/AAdvantage cardmember you are not eligible for this offer on your existing account ''. In light of this restriction that my existing Citi/AAdvantage credit card account ( s ) were not eligible for the offers, I opened a new Citi/AAdvantage credit card account in response to each such offer. 

Following approval by Citi of each credit card application submitted in response to these offers, I received confirmation of each account approval and the associated offer terms in the form of an " Account Approval Notice '', an example of which is attached herewith as Exhibit D. This Account Approval Notice in Exhibit D, for example, was mailed on XX/XX/XXXX following approval of the account ending in XXXX, and confirms that I would " [ e ] arn XXXX XXXX XXXX AAdvantage bonus miles after spending {$2500.00} in purchases within the first 3 months of account opening ''. Indeed, these miles were duly issued into my account in the statement dated XX/XX/XXXX ( see Exhibit B ) in accordance with the offer terms.

Sub-issue: You never received your bill or did not know a payment was due
Consumer complaint narrative:
I have been trying to have the right amount, address and credit card info to pay Macy back since 2015. I've researched and realized that I'm not the only victim to Macy 's poor practices dealing with their credit card. Due to their inability to have correct and timely financial information, I disputed. However, they put it as delinquent and no one was ever able to help rectify to make me whole. Finally, I wrote the XXXX, XXXX XXXX of Macy 's to see if he can help. Again, they missed the mark of understanding that they failed to provide the accurate amount, account information, credit card, disclosures and address to send payment. Because of their deficiencies, I was unable to pay. I didn't even have the account number! I have spent no less than 50 hours trying to fix this over the years. Even now, I resent a note a couple months ago. Still same back and forth with no accountability. This is quite deceptive. They should not offer credit cards if they don't know how to manage the business. 

Below is the letter that I sent. 
XXXX Dear XXXX, I can appreciate what you're doing for Macy 's and trying to sustain the business during this challenging time. 

This is why I'm reaching out to you at this time. I'm thinking that you can help me fix this. For +/-4 years, I have emailed and mailed notes to customer service addresses in OH and executives XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX to fix my credit situation. Now, I'm trying to refinance and there's a big black mark on my credit due to the inadequate processes in Macy 's credit card and customer service departments. 

Here 's the deal - I have about {$300.00} that I owe which I can easily pay - but as a finance person, I would like to have the exact amount and bill that I should pay. No one - has been able to produce this for me. I've been harassed by your customer service people, been hung up, insulted and now chased by creditors because of the poor processes and infrastructure set up by Macy 's credit card business. 

I signed up for a credit card at the store to receive a discount. I never received any paperwork or credit card, which looking back seem to be a poor on boarding situation. I kept my receipt and returned a few items. Months later, I finally received a credit card with a late fee and interest charges. I called customer service and got bounced to the XXXX, another country, back to US and back to XXXX. I made multiple attempts to get the final amount, minus all fees and interest charges and minus returns. Also, I needed the credit card statement. I believe, having worked in banks for 20+ years, this is a reasonable and minimum requirement for any financial services company. 

My ask - please send me the summary which includes the original purchase, minus return, minus interest fee and any excess fees. Please provide the account number and address so I know where to pay the check. Please do this as soon as possible because I need to refinance ASAP in this horrible market. 

Best wishes to you and your family. 
Thank you for your help.

After waiting over month to receive my money by Citibank, I finally received my funds transferred to my bank account. Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX, we received an alert on the Positive Pay Exceptions, a Citi Bank system to detect irregularities, for one of  the checks ( {$200.00} ) issued by my employer indicating a duplicate presentment of a check on XX/XX/XXXX, asking our action to take. We immediately requested " Stop Payment '' via the online banking. With regard to the Positive Pay Exception, the said check was issued to one of our colleagues. 

The check was physically deposited with the original paper document by the employee, not via the check photo, at which the custody of the original document transferred to the bank for further processes. The colleagues bank is also Citi. We asked Citi to investigate the incident and inform us of findings. The response was, " With the increased use of check scanners and banks allowing photos of checks in order to make deposits, Citi does not physically receive checks in most cases. When the depositor retains control of the check, it is not unheard of for checks to be presented more than once. I have requested that the duplicate posting be reversed and will let you know once that is complete. Please let me know if you have any questions. '' However, this comment was totally irrelevant because the deposit was made with the original paper check. Even though there was no monetary damage caused to us, such an attempt for duplicate presentment of checks is a matter of grave significance. If there was a malicious person who purposely made an attempt to encash a check twice, it could be a crime. I would like to report this, hoping there will be additional investigation or corrective action, if any, to be taken.

I received a new Citi Aadvantage Platinum Select card a couple of weeks ago and tried to use it and it was denied. Had to pay a {$7.00} atm fee to make the purchase and opened the Citi app and it said something was flagged for fraud. I called the provided number and the representative asked for a landline to call. I do not have a landline phone and they also asked if I had a Citi checking or another Citi credit account, which I do not. Finally, they asked if they could contact my work number which is not possible since all of our work calls go to a general switchboard. 

After these options were exhausted they stated that they would be mailing me a letter for verification and that will take 7-10 business days. They would not accept any other form of verification and now I am left without access to my account for this amount of time and can not even see what he possible fraud may be to take action. I asked to cancel the card and they said I was unable to do that at this time due to the fraud alert.

It is unacceptable that I can not know about the details of potential fraud and can not verify my identify without having a landline ( which is really common now ) or having another account through their bank. I attempted to speak with a supervisor but was not connected and the employees I spoke with would not give any identifying information I could share with a supervisor about the treatment. 

Now I have potential fraudulent charges on an account that is less than a month old that I have to wait almost two weeks to resolve. CitiBank has terrible customer service and puts your financial and personal data at risk by being lax enough that somebody was likely able to breach an account that is less than a month old and then blocking their customers from being able to take action.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, or personal loan
Issue: Charged fees or interest you didn't expect
Sub-issue: None
Consumer complaint narrative:
Received and accepted an offer 2 mo ago to open a " Flex Loan '' with " fixed rate of 9.99 % '' & " monthly payment of {$96.00} ''. Before I accepted the offer, I paid off all debt on the Citi card from which the offer initiated to start with a XXXX   balance and maximize the low interest rate of the " loan '' up to my credit limit on my Citi acct. 
Citi changed my loan payment by 17 % immediately, by 26 % on the first statement and by 35 % on the 2nd statement. They first said the variance was interest. I told them a loan payment includes both the principal and the interest : that's what a fixed rate loan is : your monthly payment is always the same. Then they said I had additional charges on my account. I didn't and my statement indicated so. Then they said there was a {$25.00} " minimum fee ''. I told them again, my payment is far over {$25.00} but there is no minimum or maximum payment on a loan. The " minimum '' is the payment amount ; you pay the payment amount or default. It includes interest. If you pay more than that it goes toward principle. If you charge me more than the loan amount and don't credit it towards principle, you're charging me interest on the interest and your advertised 10 % fixed rate APR is false. 
I was never late on a payment ( which they didn't deny ). It's set to autodraft. This is inexplicable by any math. My math : Loan AMT x APR of 10 % x years in the loan term = total interest to be paid. Total interest + loan amount = total amount due over term of loan. Total AMT due / # of mo in term = monthly payment. 
They went back & forth to their payment calculators several times coming back with a different amt the payment should be & nonsensical explanation every time. This is arithmetic. It doesn't require a calculator but noone at Citi ( spoke to 3 supervisors ) can follow it. Or so they'd like you to think. 
This is what's going on : I had next to nothing on that card bec of the bad 27 % interest rate ( advertised as 12.9 % ). So they advertised a false " loan '' product to get me to move funds over from another card with what should have been a higher interest rate and then changed the terms immediately so that the " loan '' rate ends up being worse than the interest rate I'd pay even on the higher interest Citi card, had I been using the card and making direct purchases regularly. Citibank : you pay 27 % interest off the bat on purchases, or they trick you into paying 35 % on a false " fixed '' rate " loan '' product. Predatory Crooks the type that crashed the economy in 2008. Please remove their licenses.

Consumer complaint narrative:
This is a fraudulent account opened by someone who stole my identity. Therefore, I am disputing this debt because I do not owe it. Because I am disputing this debt, you should not report it to the credit reporting agencies. If you have already reported it, please contact the credit reporting agencies, inform them that the debt is disputed, and ask them to delete it from my credit report. Reporting information that you know to be inaccurate, or failing to report information correctly, violates the Fair Credit Reporting Act. 
Macys has been linked with multiple data breach where people personal information including payment details have been stolen https : XXXX https : XXXX I have previously contacted Macys to report this account as fraudulent and was told to file an identity theft report which I did and is include in this dispute. I have also included a NOTICE TO FURNISHERS and a copy of my previous and current drivers license to show that I have been continuously living in the XXXX XXXX XXXX since 2012. I have never received any paperwork, contract agreement, bills, goods or services at my address shown on my drivers license. 
I respectfully request that Macys provides me with the following : Signed contract or agreement showing my name and address ; Copy of my drivers license, social security or any other relevant information ; Any goods or services that was received ; Any bills or receipt that was sent to the address ; Proof that Macys attempted or contacted me regarding this account ( certified mail, letter, etc ... ) showing my address. 
I am asserting my rights under the federal and state Fair Debt Collection Practices Acts and the Fair Credit Reporting Act, including this right : Any attempt to collect this debt without validating it violates the FDCPA. 
Until Macys provide concrete evidence requested above, the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau must take action to make sure that I am protected from those unfair acts and practices Finally, if you do not own this debt, I demand that you immediately send a copy of this dispute letter to the original creditor so they are also aware that I dispute the debt. If you do not comply with this request, I will immediately file a complaint with the Federal Trade Commission and Attorney Generals office. Civil and criminal claims will be pursued. 
XXXX XXXX

I write to dispute {$32.00} in late charges ( fees and interest ) that Department Stores National Bank, as issuer of my Macys American Express Card, ending in XXXX, assessed against me in XX/XX/2020. 

I opened the card in question on or about XX/XX/2020 and made one charge on that date. My wife paid the corresponding XXXX invoice in full. She mailed the check on or before the due date but, according to the issuer, the payment was not received until a few days later. For that minor delay, the issuer imposed {$32.00} in late charges on an invoice of {$150.00} a penalty of nearly 21 % for a bill that was paid in full. 

I attempted on numerous occasions to communicate with the issuer, by phone and by e-mail, without success. My e-mails have not been returned. And my phone calls resulted in recorded messages saying that no representatives were available and either asking me to call back at a different time or providing unacceptably long hold/wait times. 

Because my efforts to reach a human being were not successful, and to avoid the assessment of further penalties, I paid the late charges under protest, while continuing to request that the charges be removed and the amount I had now paid credited back to me. I have received no response, despite the passage of multiple weeks. 

As a result, I have sent a letter to the issuer, bearing today 's date, directing it to cancel my card immediately. I also advised the issuer that I would be filing a complaint with this Bureau. 

I request two forms of relief : ( 1 ) credit in full for all fees and interest charged in or after XX/XX/2020 ; and ( 2 ) immediate cancellation of the disputed card.

I went to Citibank to deposit money for my account and they denied me the opportunity to do this. At the bank they told me that there was a note written from their back office. XXXX told me to wait until tomorrow and I would hear from the bank. On XX/XX/2020 when I emailed the personal banker XXXX  on informing him I got a letter from Citibank fraud department. He never responded to me. I also never heard anything back from the bank So I called customer service and asked the agent to transfer me to the fraud team. They informed me the department was closed. The next day I contacted the fraud department at phone number I received in the mail and it was still closed. I was calling during business hours and the fraud department was closed. I thought this was an error so I called customer service again at XXXX. They told me to call back because the department was closed. I called again at XXXX XXXX  and the department was still closed. 
I then called a different number to get to the fraud department. The fraud department informed me that I need to call the identity theft department. The caveat here is I called the number the fraud department gave me to the identity theft department. When I called the identity theft department there was a message that department was permanently closed. I then call the fraud department back and they said thats who I have to talk to. 

I am so frustrated with no being able to reach anyone that I file a complaint with the XXXX  so I can get a hold of someone. I was informed they need to investigate this. At this point I don't believe anything Citibank tells me because any information I have gotten has been wrong or no one has followed up. 

Citibank is a good company I have had great relationships with them with their credit cards. My mother also had Citicard for years and always praised Citibank for their great customer service. I have even had a Citibank account in XXXX. 

What concerns me is that I spent 2 hours of my time going to the bank to open the account. Then I do not receive any mail for 3 weeks saying theirs an issue with my account. Then when I go to address it at the bank or over the phone I have no one to help me resolve this problem. 

I find it very serious and inconvenient that I opened an account and they want to close it without me telling them to. I also find it very serious that if I want to open accounts in the future with Citibank that theyre not going to keep it open. 

What frustrates me even more is I was sent a targeted offer to open a bank account to earn 50,000 miles. I opened it on time and now if they close my account I am not going to be able to get the miles. I was going to use those miles to visit my grandmother in XXXX who is XXXX and can die at any time. This is the second time I was sent an offer and now they want to take it back which is not cool. The first time Citi cards sent me an offer on the platinum card but they should not have so they gave me 10,000 miles. I just want to bank at XXXX like every other customer that uses this bank! I also want to keep my bonus miles opportunity. 

What I also did not get is their was an opportunity to get less miles and deposit less money but the banker did not understand what I was talking about but it says that in the offer. 

I would have informed you that it was identity theft but it was not. I have been a victim of identity them and have attached the police report. Opening this bank account is not identity theft because I opened it myself. 
I also want to say that Citibank pulled my chexsytems. I now have their inquires on my credit reports. I feel that its unfair that they close the account because now I have to have more inquiries on my credit report which affects my credit when applying to other backs. I can be denied credit because of this. If I have to reopen a new account thats more inquiries on my credit report. That is not cool

On XX/XX/2020 I purchased as a gift, the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Model # XXXX @ {$1000.00}, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Model # XXXX @ {$1000.00}, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  and Installation Package @ {$350.00}. The bill of sale totaled {$2600.00}. One-half ( 1/2 ) of the total - {$1300.00} was charged to XXXX XXXX and the balance - {$1300.00} was charged to the merchants financial Citi Brand Source charge card. 
XX/XX/2020 The merchants delayed install & stock availability, resulted in only a partial delivery & install of the brand new out-of-box appliances to the gift recipients residence. 
XX/XX/2020 After a two-day window was established by the merchant, a follow up delivery and install were made to the gift recipients residence. 
XX/XX/2020 While preparing the newly installed appliances for use on this date, ( neither of the appliances were in use on or prior to this date ) one of the glass shelves exploded in the hands of the owner/recipient of this appliance. Simultaneously, the door of the XXXX XXXX became unhinged, preventing the door to close, thus deeming the oven INOPERABLE per the Manufacturer. 
XX/XX/2020 The merchant was immediately contacted and advised that both appliances were shown to have manufacturer defects prior to their use. The merchant and a XXXX representative refused to return and refund the appliances ; stating, repairs are performed on manufacturer defective appliances based on XXXX warranty. 
XX/XX/2020 I contacted XXXX XXXX to request the charge amount of {$1300.00} be placed under dispute due to the merchants refusal to return & refund the defective appliances received. It was stated that the company would suspend transaction pending investigation 8 to 12 weeks. I also contacted Citi Brand Source to request the charge amount of {$1300.00} be placed under dispute due to the merchants refusal to return & refund the defective appliances received. It was stated that the company would open a dispute which will take 6 weeks. 
XX/XX/2020 Follow up contact was made to Citi Brand Source in which the Dispute Dept rep stated the investigation would take 30 days, but ultimately it was up to the store whether they would accept return & refund appliances. 
XX/XX/2020 Correspondence received from Citi Retail Services stating their investigation determined I would be responsible for the disputed charges. However, the dispute would be reopened, provided supporting documentation was received prior to XX/XX/2020. 
XX/XX/2020 I contacted Citi Retail Services and discussed where/how to send the supporting documentation. The customer service rep provided multiple fax numbers and/or mailing address. XX/XX/2020 Per the customer service rep, the Dispute would be reopened as the submitted 27 faxed pages of additional documentation and the same 27 pages of supporting documents was received via USPS to the Retail Services. 
XX/XX/2020 Upon receipt of an account billing showing payment due XX/XX/XXXX, I contacted Citi Brand Source and spoke to a Dispute Dept rep who confirmed their receipt of both the faxed 27-page documents and the USPS receipt of the same documents. The rep advised the billing was auto-generated and the Dispute was in fact reopened. 
XX/XX/2020 A follow up contact to Citi Brand Source for status resulted in a conversation with the Dispute Dept Supervisor, stating the investigation was closed on XX/XX/2020 because of the merchants warranty. After further discussion, the supervisor agreed the dispute would be reopened and reassessed based on the recently submitted supporting documents received XX/XX/2020. 
XX/XX/2020 A follow up contact to Citi Brand Source for status resulted in a conversation with a Dispute Dept rep who stated the Dispute is closed. I requested & spoke to a department manager who stated the appliances are under warranty. After further discussion, the supervisor agreed the dispute would be reopened. I asked for a letter stating the same. The manager agreed ; however, no letter has ever been received. 
XX/XX/2020 Received Citi Brand Sources account billing showing payment due XX/XX/2020, past due {$0.00}, minimum payment due {$28.00}. 
XX/XX/2020 Received a collection call from Citi Brand Source account billing. I asked for the Dispute Dept and was told the dispute was closed. I asked for a written document stating that the dispute was closed and the reason for the closure. I re-contacted this credit card issuer up with another call to the Dispute Dept and spoke to a manager/supervisor who agreed the dispute would be escalated for further processing. 
XX/XX/2020 Received a collection call from Citi Brand Source. I immediately requested the Dispute Dept. The dispute rep stated I would need to work with the merchant to resolve the dispute. It was further stated by the rep, their records do not reflect two appliances only 1 a refrigerator. I explained the bill of sale purchase was for 2 appliances which included a cooking range. The rep stated, There is nothing more they would do on the account, the dispute is closed and they can not force the merchant to return the appliances. I requested a letter stating the closure of the dispute and reason. The rep stated, that would not be done. 
XX/XX/2020 It must be noted at this juncture, that XXXX XXXX issued its investigative findings of closure and issued a credit for the balance amount of {$1300.00}, stating XXXX XXXX XXXX has not yet provided the necessary information. '' By contrast, Citi Brand Source continued to blunder its way through a feigned dispute investigation resulting in my initiating over 21 separate phone calls, at least 4 requests to reopen their premature closures, while additionally providing numerous supporting documents regarding the manufacturer defected appliances. 
XX/XX/2020 I sent a follow up email to Citi Brand Source regarding disputed charges investigated by a card issuer are required by law to issue a written advisement within 30-90 days and the reason for the decision. 
XX/XX/2020 Received alerts from ( all ) three Credit Bureaus, in which Citi Brand Sources submitted a negative 30-days XXXX delinquency account billing. 
XX/XX/2020 I filed disputes will all three Credit Bureaus XXXX, XXXX XXXX, XXXX 
XX/XX/2020 Received correspondence via US mail from Citi Brand Source advising their credit line was being lowered on the issued credit card from {$5000.00} t0 {$1400.00} due to my Credit Score as of XX/XX/2020 of XXXX Credit scores range from low of XXXX to a high of XXXX. 
XX/XX/2020 Received billing via US mail from Citi Brand Source advising the account 's Previous Balance - {$1300.00} ; New Balance - {$1300.00} ; Past Due Amount - {$70.00} ; Min Payment Due - {$120.00} ; Payment Due Date - XX/XX/2020 ; Fees Charged + {$41.00}.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I have called twice ( once today, XX/XX/2020 ) and once on approximately XX/XX/2020 to request my account be reviewed for a lower than the maximum interest rate. I believe that they are charging me substantially more than they should be due to how my bill looks and due to the fact that I make on time payments regularly. The XXXX call resulted in the gentleman looking at my account and telling me I would receive a letter in the mail and to call back after I received the letter. The call today resulted in them demanding my cellular number so they could text me a code. I declined that because I do not want to get more junk calls and texts than I already do from automatic dialers on my cell phone. They then transferred me to their " fraud '' department. the lady asked me if I had any other checking accounts or savings accounts with them and demanded a phone number where she could call me right back to verify it was me. I gave her a phone number. I also provided my mothers maiden name, I provided my social security number, my zip code. I have not used this card in years and am just paying down the balance. I pay XXXX and XXXX of that goes to interest on a balance of {$14000.00}. the math does not add up on this. I have a XXXX XXXX card and pay less on a higher balance which I am also paying down. 

I am not looking for a free ride but citi is doing something VERY disturbing and shady here. by the way, its been 45 minutes and no one has called me back. so no letter in the mail that they claimed I would receive, no call back that they claimed I would receive and all because I would not provide a cellular telephone number. 

I have had this credit card for more than 15 years and have made regular payments. a maximum percentage rate with no one even entertaining lowering it is in violation of federal law. they are supposed to review your credit every 6 months and they are not even trying to do that.

This documentation clearly shows that CITI is in clear violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), Unfair, Deceptive and Abusive Act Practices ( UDAAP ), and Federal Trade Act ( FTA ) by requesting a lower monthly payment amount to keep account current and still reporting XX/XX/2018 payment as late to the credit bureau. If you see, all other months in 2018, I had similar balances and lower payments were allowed and paid to stay current.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I have a citi credit card with a flex loan balance ( maturing XX/XX/XXXX ) and a zero percent interest balance on it ( zero percent expiring XX/XX/XXXX ). On XX/XX/XXXX I had enough cash on hand to pay off the XXXX balance portion and submitted the payment through their online portal. The online portal has payment options that are : 1 ) Minimum due This is the amount that is scheduled to be paid by Autopay on XX/XX/XXXX, and includes your monthly Flex Plan payment. 
2 ) Adjusted New Balance + Flex Plan Monthly Payment This includes your monthly Flex Plan Payment Amount and the non-Flex Plan portion of your last statement balance. It does not include Flex Plan payments due in future months. 
3 ) Last statement balance This is the amount you owe from your most recent statement dated XX/XX/XXXX, and includes your Flex balance. 
4 ) Current balance This is the total amount you currently owe. 
5 ) Custom Amount I select option number 2, which according to the description should have paid off the zero percent interest balance on my card so I would then only have the remaining flex loan payments left. My payment was processed for option number 2, however Citi did not pay down the balance on credit card but instead paid down the flex portion of my loan. I contacted customer service on XX/XX/XXXX to have this corrected however i was told that they are unable to do that, the only option was for Citi to reverse the payment and charge me a purchase APR on it. I pointed out to them that their payment section of their website was misleading and their response was the terms of the flex loan state how payments are processed. While this may be  true, the payment section of the website is directly contradicting this. I am now in a situation when my zero percent interest expires in XXXX I will be paying a 19 % interest rate even though I attempted to pay off the balance in XXXX following the instructions on their website.

Around Set XXXX we got a surprise when we found out that our card was frauded by someone reason why Citibank issued a new card and told us to destroy the one we had and wait while they were gon na send us a new one, which we did. We contacted the bank and told us to cancel it. As expected we had to dispute those {$1800.00} since we didnt use them and that balance was showing on our credit. We have been disputing this money for months until the Investigation Department of Citibank reaches out and told us that it was all good and we were not going to have to pay that money, we even got a letter saying that ( attached document ). Big was our surprise when we noticed that Citibank deposited {$1800.00} to a Checking Account # XXXX, because this account DID NOT BELONG TO ME NOR MY SISTER. Unfortunately we found out about that because our debt was not being clear from our credit. My sister has tried calling them many times for the past weeks and they deny to give her any information until she pays her debt, currently she is being harassed on a daily basis with phone calls regarding paying her debt and when she explains the situation she gets responses like we wont give you any information until you set your debt straight. 
I have personally gone to the Branch in XXXX and spoken to a representative ( XXXX XXXX ) who after digging into the system found out that apparently we were issued a care number that was already given to someone else. The Cash advance withdrawals ( {$1800.00} ) showed in this individual account but the credit showed in ours. He mentioned he never saw something like that and tried calling his supervisor who was never reachable and any other person would just tell him I dont know. Finally he filed a complaint to the Presidential Complaint on Tuesday XX/XX/XXXX and said that we would hear in 2 business days. I have personally made an effort to get in touch with Citibank through their XXXX   account, got connected with Ms XXXX from the South Dakota branch ( XXXX ) who after explaining the whole situation again told me she was gon na investigate and file a complaint to the Presidential Complaint Unit and I would hear back in 2 days. 
So far I have not heard back from any of them despite the fact that I write them but my sister keeps getting harassing phone calls saying that our due day is on the XXXX and of course if we dont pay our Credit will be affected, since now its not longer {$1800.00} but {$2000.00}. 
We have tried many times to get this problem solved but apparently the bank has no intention to hold anyone accountable for something they did and more importantly something that is causing me and my sister sleepless nights, time waste, frustration and exhaustion. 
Please I need to get this problem solved as soon as possible in an attempt not to damage my sister and my credit score since we have always been responsible when it comes to payment matters.

Consumer complaint narrative: I purchased a XXXX dishwasher from BestBuy on XX/XX/2019 for delivery on XX/XX/2019. I opened a BestBuy / Citibank credit card at the time at the XXXX XXXX, XXXX, NY BestBuy store. The saleswomen suggested I purchase a deluxe installation kit ( {$29.00} + {$2.00} tax ) and a haul-away service ( {$19.00} ). I agreed to these additions. The dishwasher was delivered as agreed to, but the delivery did not include the installation kit and the delivery men refused to haul away the old dishwasher. I signed a delivery logbook the delivery man presented, noting that the delivery men refused to haul away the old dishwasher. This book contained multiple entries, I assume for other deliveries. The old dishwasher sat in my dining room for a week until my nephew and I carried it out for pickup by XXXX curbside recycling program on XX/XX/2019. I have affidavits attesting to this. The installation kit was not delivered, but not necessary since I was able to use the existing copper lines. I raised the complaint with BestBuy on XX/XX/2019, on BestBuy 's XXXX page -- their recommended method. I received an automated response but nothing else. I have a printout of this. I paid for the dishwasher in full, {$480.00}, when due. I disputed the {$52.00} charge for unfulfilled goods and services, in XX/XX/2019 with Citibank. Citibank rejected my dispute presenting a number of documents including a BestBuy / XXXX XXXX acceptance form with a forged signature. I never saw such a document, nor does the signature in any way resemble mine. I wrote Citibank dispute center on XX/XX/2019 by US mail and again on XX/XX/2019. Neither of these letters was responded to. In a conversation on XX/XX/2019 with a woman identifying herself as XXXX at the Tennessee Citibank dispute call center, I found out that the first letter was on file but never responded to. I got a call from XXXXon XX/XX/2019, that lasted 42 minutes. It resulted in the late charges being removed and I thought in the dispute being resolved, but the dispute remains! And late charges have again been applied. Subsequently, Citibank has reported my account delinquent. This is the first time in over 39 years of credit history I have ever had a credit card claim me delinquent. My FICO  score was above 800 last summer and has now plummeted to a low of XXXX! Obviously, Citibank has caused me harm. If I were to apply for a car loan, I would be charged a much higher rate. If Citibank even bothered to check, it would discover that my other two cards with Citibank -- LL Bean and Costco -- are always paid in full on time, as are all my credit cards.

Sub-issue: Problem during payment process
Consumer complaint narrative: Had a substantial minimum payment due on credit card. Went and made the payment, unaware that even though I'd made the payment they would still try to debit the automatic minimum payment due regardless of whether it had been paid yet or not. Because that amount was more than what was in my checking account ( again I'd already paid that amount ), that bounced and I got charged {$29.00} by the credit card company for the bounce and {$34.00} by the bank ( same company as credit card - Citi ). I called and talked to them so I understood and I could deal with that. However when on that call the CSR did NOT tell me that the minimum payment would try to be put through again automatically. It did and I got dinged another {$29.00} and XXXX $ ( now up to {$120.00} ). I called to complain about that, could not get through, went on chat and compained there, no one responded, but I did see a {$34.00} credit on my bank account Then again today I get another message that said the minimum amount ( it's over {$2000.00} ) was tried to be put through AGAIN. And voila another {$34.00} charge on my bank account. I don't know when this will stop. Tried again to get through via chat ( which is what they are recommending ) and it won't connect. The idea that a minimum automatic minimum payment will be put through EVEN IF THE MINIMUM PAYMENT HAS ALREADY BEEN PAID is suspect and it occurs to me is designed to generate more fees for the company unnecessarily and at consumers ' expense. I could turn off the automatic payment and then that could generate late fees for them. I have other cards that don't do it this way - they only take the automatic minimum payment if there is any amount left due on the minimum payment, otherwise they don't take anything.

Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/2020 I sent written communication to Macys/Dsnb dated XX/XX/2020, requesting documentation to substantiate information being furnished to the national crediting reporting agencies on account number XXXXXXXX. Instead, Macys/Dsnb sent me a letter stating that the information appearing on my credit report was correct. I made a request for them substantiate the information theyre reporting is pursuant to the FCRA/FACTA, thereby causing Macys/Dsnb communication to be significant of a non-response within the statutory 30-day time period to respond. FCRA 623/FACTA 312 requires Macys/Dsnb t to provide the following : ( 1 ) Proof of Liability via original application, ( 2 ) The Terms of the alleged liability, ( 3 ) Proof of performance made by me, ( 4 ) Proof of any other information contained in the credit report regarding the account.  Macys/Dsnb provided none of the above. Macys/Dsnb continue to report unsubstantiated information to my credit report in violation of my consumer rights and is attempting to benefit commercially by violating federal law which potentially makes them actionable by criminal complaint. Macys/Dsnb has violated the Red Flags Rule and Metro-2 Reporting Standards, thereby violating my rights under the FCRA, ECOA, and FCBA. Furthermore, on XX/XX/2020 I sent a second written communication to Macys/Dsnb dated XX/XX/2020, requesting the same information with same results dated XX/XX/2020. Consumer complaint narrative:
Hello, We were the victims of fraud through Citibank/XXXX. 
Timeline : -Listed couch for sale late XXXX XXXX for {$280.00}. 
-We get an offer from a male that sends us a cashier 's check for {$1900.00} to pay us for the couch & movers that are coming to pick it up -Check deposited XX/XX/XXXX ( it was a fraudulent check ). 
-It took Citibank over a week to report this to us and we received a letter on XX/XX/XXXX. We have never bounced a check and didn't realize it took several days for us to get notified! Note that we have been Citibank customers for over 30 years. 
-Assuming check had cleared as funds were in our account on XX/XX/XXXX, and trusting XXXX since Citibank backs/has a partnership with them, we made a RELATED XXXX payment for {$1700.00} on XX/XX/XXXX. This was for what the scammers said was for movers minus couch- that they ended up not coming to pick up on XX/XX/XXXX ( the day before the check bounced, but 3 days before we were notified AT ALL by a letter that arrived in the mail ). 
-So, we LOST {$1700.00} as a result of this SCAM by a service pushed by Citibank as a partner plus the {$12.00} bounced check fee. 
-We reached out to Citibank twice with the information and twice they denied our claim saying we had authorized the transaction ( yes, we did but assumed funds posted properly in our CITIBANK account ) so they would NOT help us at all. Again, this is after we provided Citibank all the information we had and used a service pushed by our bank that we were loyal to for over three decades. So, we thought it was safely backed for customer usage in the event of any fraudulent activities. 
-The last denial arrived via mail on XXXX XXXX XXXX 
We provided details of the fraudulent check, the UPS tracking information in which the cashier 's check came, as well as another XXXX XXXX account the scammers gave us when they thought we'd send them the balance for the couch they never came to pick up. We also provided a cell phone number used that was still active at the time. They refused to investigate at all and/or help us track him down to try to recover our money.

Consumer complaint narrative:
citi bank runs a promotion open a new checking and savings account and deposit XXXX of my money for 60 days and citi will deposit XXXX dollars into my checking account within 90 days after meeting the 60 days of XXXX dollars in a new checking and savings account combined. i deposited XXXX into a new checking and savings account on XX/XX/XXXX. The Contract 1 TERMS AND CONDITIONS Eligible Customers can earn the {$200.00}, {$400.00}, {$700.00} or {$1500.00} Cash Bonus during the Offer Period by completing the following Required Activities. 

By participating in the Checking Cash Bonus Offer, you agree to be bound by the following Terms and Conditions. 

If you choose to change packages within 30 days of account opening ( see Package Options below ), your change reflects 1 ) that you have reviewed the new package offers terms and conditions, which appear in this document and 2 ) have consented to participate in the offer for that package. 

Eligible Customers Eligible Customers are New-to-Citibank Checking Customers who have not been a signer on a Citibank checking account within the past 180 days. 

Required Activities If Eligible Customers open their eligible accounts by any other means than those described, they will not be enrolled in this Offer and will not be eligible for the Cash Bonus. 

Eligible Customers must : First, open a new consumer regular or interest checking account between XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX in an eligible Account Package listed in the Chart below ( Eligible Checking Account ). Certain Cash Bonus offers also require opening a new Citi Savings Account ( see Chart below ) in the same account package as the new Eligible Checking Account ( Eligible Savings Account ). The Eligible Savings Account must be opened within 30 days of the checking accounts Account Opening Date. 

Second, enroll in this offer at the same time as account opening pursuant to the instructions provided. Customer is automatically enrolled when applying online Third, any owner of the eligible accounts must make at least the Minimum Deposit ( see Chart below ) in New-to-Citibank Funds, within 30 calendar days of the Account Opening Date of the checking account, into either the new Eligible Checking Account and/or the new Eligible Savings Account. Multiple deposits allowed.

New-to-Citibank Funds are 1 ) funds deposited from external accounts or payees other than Citibank N.A. 2 ) using domestic ACH transfer, Direct Deposit, checks drawn on banks other than Citibank N.A. or wire transfer. Cash deposits, Citi Global Transfers, international ACH transfers, and person-to-person transfer services such as XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX, do not qualify as New-to-Citibank Funds. 

Fourth, the Minimum Deposit ( see Chart below ) must be maintained for 60 consecutive calendar days from the date the Minimum Deposit is met ( Minimum Balance ). The Minimum Balance may be held entirely in one of the Eligible Accounts or across both of the Eligible Accounts. 

Note : If you choose to keep your entire Minimum Balance in one account, any account that maintains a zero balance for 90 days is subject to closure in Citibanks sole discretion.

At the time the Cash Bonus is paid, it will be credited to the new Eligible Checking Account. If the Eligible Checking Account is closed, then the Cash Bonus will be credited to the new Eligible Savings Account. Open accounts must be in good standing.

Consumer complaint narrative: I received a notice last week that my Citibank checking account was being closed. I got in touch with them and was told by a customer service rep that once my account had a positive balance it would be active again. My direct deposits had stopped due to being laid off from work due to coronavirus. Seeing as the customer service rep said the account would be active when it had a positive balance I took no further action. The reason for my inquiry on the account was due to the fact that my government stimulus check was going to be deposited into the account. It had a negative {$130.00} balance so after being told what I was told, which I have documented, I thought the stimulus money would cover the {$130.00} negative balance and I would have {$1000.00} for myself to feed my family on. The day that the stimulus was to be deposited into my account I checked it and it went from the negative {$130.00} balance to a {$0.00} balance. Then it said account was closed. I contacted Citibank and I was told that they could see my money was there and for me to call and they would reopen my account. Now, over the course of 3 days and communicating with 6 different customer service reps, 3 of them have said they can see my money is there but that they cant open the account. A fourth customer service rep told me that they would mail me a check for the {$1000.00}. Then the last customer service rep I talked to told me that my money had been sent back to the IRS, which is a lie also. I do not mind paying them what I owed for the negative balance but, I had been waiting on that money so I could provide for my family and they turn into monsters and decide that they are going to hold my money hostage. All of this has made me XXXX  as a man that cant provide for his family does not deserve to live. Its been lie after lie after lie. How could they, and would they, close a mans account on the day he is to receive such a deposit into it as this stimulus money was to be and for what it means to him and his family. They said that when a account has a negative balance for so many days it is then closed. Well they couldnt give me one more day in order to receive that money? And seeing as what familys all across this country are going through. Now, I cant get ahold of anyone and do not know when or how I am going to get access to my money in order to feed my family. Citibank are monsters!!

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Sub-issue: Problem with rewards from credit card
Consumer complaint narrative:
This complaint concern Citi and XXXX XXXX and the unfair practices they have used with regards to their Citi AAdvantage Platinum Select cards and the miles they provide for promotional bonuses and regular spending. 

Over the last several years I have earned AAdvantage miles through bonus offers provided by Citi and paid out by XXXX XXXX. I have also earned miles through regular spending on my card. Because I own several XXXX, in the past I have opened several Citi AAdvantage Platinum Select cards. I only contemplated opening a second card because an XXXX XXXX flight attendant was attempting to get passengers on a flight to sign up for one of the credit card offers. I mentioned to her that I already had a card, and she informed me that as long as the application didn't specify any terms about not being eligible, that I could apply for another card and earn the bonus again. 

As a result I accrued a fairly substantial AAdvantage program balance. 

On XX/XX/2019 I attempted to book a reservation using some of my miles. The process for booking an AAdvantage award reservation involved " booking '' the reservation, and then waiting for the airline to actually " ticket '' it. After booking, the reservation will stay in a " ticket pending '' mode until the ticketing department issues the ticket and deducts the miles from your account to pay for it. This process typically takes a few hours. In my case it had been 24 hours and it still had not ticketed so I called in to try and resolve the issue. The next day I spoke to an agent who rebooked the reservation to try and solve the problem, but after another 24 hours this new reservation also had not been ticketed. 

I called in once again and after a long time on the phone, I was told my AAdvantage account had been " locked '' by XXXX XXXX and that I would be unable to use my account. I asked why the account had been locked and was provided no information. Since that day I have called into AAdvantage customer service, called and left several voicemails at the XXXX XXXX department, emailed customer relations, messaged the airline 's XXXX account, emailed several members of staff ( including executives ), and sent paper mail to several employees ( once again, including executives ). I have yet to receive an explanation for why my account is locked, and I continue to be unable to utilize my miles. 

Since this issue, I have done some research and learned the airline is apparently locking and shutting down several hundred or thousand accounts in a similar fashion with no explanation. Some customers have been shut down and had reservations cancelled while overseas - being left stranded by XXXX XXXX ' deceptive business practices. The theory is that XXXX XXXX is punishing customers who utilized the Citi credit card bonus offers, despite the terms and conditions allowing them to. Some customers had as little as one or two bonuses provided to them, and were still terminated by XXXX XXXX. This is unbelievable. 

Despite XXXX XXXX and Citi being seperate entities, I thought the entangled nature of their business relationship was vital to this issue. I reached out to Citi 's executive department to explain the situation and see what they could do to remedy the problem. My opinion is that Citi and XXXX XXXX are effective operating a credit card rewards program in which you earn " miles '' which you can use on a variety of items - from flights, to gift cards, to hotels, to rental cars. In this way, despite them calling these " miles '', the AAdvantage program is essentially a rewards program. But in this case, Citi has outsourced the rewards program to XXXX XXXX. 

Because I rightfully earned these " miles '' through clear terms and conditions, I feel that Citi is obligated to either work with XXXX XXXX to reopen my account, or provide me some form of compensation ( either in their native XXXX Points rewards, or in cash ) that is equal to the value of the points I am losing and unable to use. 

Citi refused to assist me in the matter. 

Citi and XXXX XXXX are essentially engaging in Unfair, Deceptive, or Abusive Acts or Practices ( UDAAP ), and have failed to deliver on the terms of the offers I enrolled in and rightfully earned. 

It has been a month since my account was locked, and I see no end in sight to this issue. I require the assistance of the CFPB to help me solve this problem. The bank and the airline seem uninterested in assisting or even providing an explanation as to what is going on. 

My AAdvantage account number is XXXX.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Consumer complaint narrative: I have recently been temporarily laid off due to coronavirus. Im a XXXX  XXXX at a XXXX school and we have been forced to close due to this pandemic so my paychecks have stopped. As soon as I found out, I began contacting my bill companies. Every other company has worked with me by deferring my next payment to help me financially and help me not get into a serious financial situation or have my credit score ruined. CitiGroup has been the only company I have received NO assistance even with several calls to the customer service for both my CitiGroup credit cards. Im simply just asking for payment deferral until I can get my paychecks started back, after returning to work. Ive spoken to the customer service department and the hardship department at Citi. My first call was on XX/XX/XXXX, I then called again and for a 3rd time on XX/XX/XXXX and every time I was told they are aware of the coronavirus pandemic and financial hardship, but no plan is in place and bills are expected to be paid in full, on time. When I called back for the 4th time on XX/XX/XXXX I was transferred to the hardship department to see if anything could be done and was told again, no plan was in place. On the XXXX the person put notes on my accounts stating I am experiencing financial hardship and will be unable to make my payment, which is due XX/XX/XXXX, in full or on time. I called again, today, XX/XX/XXXX to inquire about a plan because my bill is due tomorrow. I was met with a very unprofessional rep named XXXX and she said there was simply nothing she could do about it. I asked for her supervisor and she gave me to someone named XXXX. She mimicked what XXXX said and said she was going to connect me with the hardship department to see if anything could be done. I was put on hold and then XXXX picks up the phone a few more times saying shes still waiting for the hardship department. She then picks up for the 4th time and literally says to me that the hardship department is experiencing high call volumes and she will need me to call back another day because she has to help other customers. That statement was extremely unprofessional. When I asked if I called back and they were busy again, she would they wait long enough to help me, as a customer, she just responded with hopefully they wont be as busy. Ultimately, no help as of tonight XX/XX/2020. My payments ( 2 cards ) is due tomorrow, I have been out of work due to coronavirus and CitiGroup is the ONLY company who has not assisted me with payment deferral. Please help me! Ive tried so much to reach out to Citi and theyve been unprofessional and had no sympathy on something that is financially devastating the whole world, COVID-19. I dont want my credit to be ruined due to this event that is out of my hands! I have a 100 % perfect payment history with not even ONE late payment. Ive taken pride in paying my bills on time and with Citi not working with me Im afraid Im spiraling towards bankruptcy! Help!

Consumer complaint narrative:
Under Citi Bank 's promotion plan, if I open a new account, deposit {$50000.00} in 30 days and keep them in the account for 60 days, I can get a {$700.00} bonus. I opened the new accounts in XX/XX/XXXX, which is the start of the nightmare. 
When I tried to deposit the money, I received the email stating that I have to submit utility bill & SSN, but I have submitted them and had received the receipt from Citi before ( see attachment 1, 2a, 2b ). It is obvious that Citi 's system had something wrong. Then I tried to contact Citi to figure it out. 
From XX/XX/XXXX, the second day of the new account opening, to XX/XX/XXXX, I have called or chatted online with the Citi agents for MORE THAN 20 TIMES ( see the attachment of Timeline ), struggling to find out what documents actually I should submit, when I can deposit the money, and even who really know the actual situation and give me a certain instruction. Sadly, in the 20-more calls or chatting, different people told me different answers. 
As all of the agents told me explicitly that I can not deposit money into the new account since it is on hold, I had to deposit them after XX/XX/XXXX, when I received the deposit notice. But Citi told me that my account does not qualify for the promotion bonus any more as I hadnt deposited the money in 30 days after account opening. It is so ridiculous! 
Firstly, it is the Citi agents who told me not to deposit the money when the documents were reviewed, which can be proved by the transcripts attached. Even more absurd is when the supervisor of the department rejected my complaint, she told me ACTUALLY I COULD deposit even the account is on hold. Who should I believe? 
Secondly, it is Citis confused management that led to the delay of document review. They kept on requesting the same documents which had been confirmed by their own system, they didnt send even one single message to request form W9 I only know it when I called by myself. I am even not sure when they have received all of my documents. 
Thirdly, Even the agent online who knows all of the processes admitted : since there was a delay of the account opening due to those documentation purposes, I'm sure that our Specialist team can enroll your account for this offer. But Citi just rejected my bonus disregarding all of the process and the records clearly kept in their system. 
I have attached the timeline of the whole case, I have attached all of the transcripts I chatted with Citi agents, and I think Citi has all of the call records in their system. I think it is quite simple to find the truth.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Hello, On XX/XX/XXXX I applied for the Citi XXXX Credit Card under a promotion stating that I would receive XXXX " Bonus Thank You Points '' in exchange for spending {$4000.00} within three months. 

I was approved for the card however did not receive the card until the week of XX/XX/XXXX. 

Due to Citi 's delay in mailing me my card I was given less then two months two complete what per their advertised terms needed to be completed within the first three months of account opening. 

On XX/XX/XXXX I reached out to Citi via chat XXXX attached ) and expressed my concern and asked for an extension. I was told to simply meet the spending requirement and they would see what could be done. Had I been told there was no flexibility I could have had the opportunity to meet the time frame they required. 

I met the spending requirement well within the three months of receiving the card but shortly after the three months of account opening. I followed up with Citi and they declined my request for issuing of Points based on their terms of spending needing to happened with the three months of account opening. 

Whether purposeful or accidental, Citi 's delaying my receipt of the card did not allow me a reasonable or fair opportunity to meet the promotional terms that they set forth. Furthermore, follow up with Citi produced disingenuous directions to continue spending without any clear indication of a fruitful outcome. 

I ask that Citi issue me the points promised based on the delay of card delivery at no fault of my own and the spending requirement met. I'll be upfront in saying if not settled through this process my next step of resolution would be a Small Claims case since the Points worth is significant. 

Thank you, XXXX

Issue: Problem with a purchase shown on your statement
Sub-issue: Credit card company isn't resolving a dispute about a purchase on your statement
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/2019 I filed a dispute on my Citibank credit card against the vacation rental company, XXXX, for vacation rental in XXXX. When I arrived in XXXX, we determined that the owner misrepresented the property. XXXX has a 100 % guarantee for all of the properties it leases online. " If a guest contact VRBO.com within the first 12 hours and the property is sufficiently different from the add, XXXX will find you another property. '' I retained every correspondence I had over 3 months with the owners of the property, I contacted XXXX within the first 2 hours after arriving and never stayed in the first property one night. XXXX did charge my Citibank card an additional {$2900.00} for the second property I found and stayed in for the remaining time on my vacation. 

I filed the dispute 10 days after XXXX stated it would refund the money of the first property. I returned from my vacation on XX/XX/2019 and filed the complaint on the XX/XX/2019. Online, I could see that is that a conditional credit was issued. However, with I received my XXXX statement, it is very confusing. The transaction history of my statement does not correspond to what occurred on my account, which makes it very difficult to research and dispute. 
The XXXX statement lists two conditional credits on XX/XX/2019 for {$3900.00}. Further on XX/XX/2019, the statement states that Citibank issued a reversal in XX/XX/2019. This is not possible because I did not leave for my vacation until XX/XX/2019. Moreover, the bank also reversed both those credits. The bank issued a reversal on XX/XX/2019 ( per the statement ) and again at the end of this 33 day billing cycle. The date on the second reversal is XX/XX/2019 of date of the original charge, but not the actual date of the second reversal. Therefore, as far as the statements show, at the end of XXXX billing cycle, the bank reserved the charges twice without contacting me regarding the investigation. Further, the billing statements states the bank determined the charges where valid. I am not sure how that could be because XXXX received payment for the property I actually stayed. Therefore, at the end XXXX billing cycle there is a {$3900.00} charge on my card. 
In XXXX I provide the bank with all of the correspondence and copies of the guarantee. On XX/XX/2019, I notice that the charge was still on my bill so I contacted the dispute department. They stated that the resolved this issue and that it was a valid charge. I told the representative, I had not received notice of this, there was not a notice online in my account. The representative told me to provide additional information with I did on XX/XX/2019.

The XXXX statement shows that Citibank issued another conditional credit on XX/XX/2019. I received an online message on XX/XX/2019 stating Good news! Weve resolved this case in your favor and issued a permanent credit for {$3900.00}. However, when I received my XXXX statement, I did open it until almost the ended of XXXX almost XXXX because I was out of town. The XXXX statement that Citibank states, the on XX/XX/2019 the bank reversed the conditional credit, and never gave me the money back when I received the message of the permanent credit on XX/XX/2019. 

On the XXXX statement, which I did not receive until late XXXX, there is a note at the bottom stating that the issue is now resolved. That statement should have been on the XXXX statement. The issue was that my online account was reflecting something completely different from my actual statement. Moreover, my statements were inaccurate and misleading because the statements do not reflect my actual transaction history as it pertains to this dispute. 
I believed that Citibank has engaged in Deceptive practices as it pertains to this dispute and my credit card statements. It is deceptive how Citibank bank disclosed the account history in correctly for 4 months, which cause a lot of confusing for me. It was deceptive for the bank to issue dispute notification online with dates that do not correspond to the transaction history on the statement. But the most egregious deception is providing notice that I have a permeant credit only to find out six weeks later the bank reversed the charges without notice. The bank states that it determined the charge was valid but did not consider that XXXX received payment for the second vacation rental for which I stayed. I need help recovering the {$3900.00} plus interest of overpayment to XXXX. At the very least, I should not have pay XXXX  for both the {$3900.00} charge and the {$2900.00} charge.

Consumer complaint narrative:
After I got my final paycheck from my company, I logged in to my credit card account and tried to make a payment. 

Then I found my account was closed by Citi. 

I was trying to call them, but no one answered the call, I tried to call moreover 20 times.

A few days later, I got the letter from the bank, it showed my account was closed due to " one or more late or returned payments in the past XXXX months ''. 

But since I used the card from 2017, I never missed any payment, but recently I got laid off due to COVID-19 from my company, and the processing of deposit check was delayed, which only caused ONE returned payment. After I got it deposited into my checking account, I already re-made the payment immediately.

But this is really unacceptable that closing my account without ANY notice and even asking. 

At the same time, I have almost XXXX XXXX XXXX on my account, which values at least {$300.00}. But I couldn't even access them, and also no one answered the call from that department. 

I'm really disappointed about the way they did, other banks are taking action when their customers are experiencing a hard time and help us through the special rough time. 

And Citibank did charge me a {$25.00} return payment fee, which is okay and reasonable. But what I can't understand is, they closed my account at this specific hard period even though they already charged me. But at the same time, the US government and other banks issue many acts and waivers to help every people affected.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/XXXX Office of The President at CitiBank Visa Subject : CitiBank Visa mobile app cost card holder Our CitiBank Visa credit card account was closed by CitiBank in XX/XX/XXXX due to an issue stemming from the use of the Citibank mobile application. Unknowingly, I had made a payment and this payment was rejected for NSF, but I had the funds in my checking. However, I was told I did not have draft protection on the savings but on the checking only. The first time this NSF incident happened I was out of the country without sufficient Wifi to catch the error. I incurred penalty charges from my bank and Citibank, but the payment was still made on time. 
After speaking with my bank, I got a new account number to input in the application but wasnt sure how to input it. I now realized that the app has an area to input the corrected or a different account number. Before I put the correct number in the app, I made a payment that went through before I corrected it. The payment was still on time. This realization happened after the last incident and I called and explained this to Citibank and the charges were debit to my accounts. 
We are asking City Bank to re-open our Visa credit card account because this was an honest mistake in using the mobile application. We obtained our cards through Costco who partnered with Citibank after they dropped XXXX XXXX. My husband and I have been customers in excellent standing with both companies for more than 12 years. We feel it is unfair to hold back our rewards earned for the XXXX billing cycle. We are requesting that you consider reinstating the XXXX billing statement with the full amount of our rewards we earned for XXXX. We look forward to hopefully doing business with you once again. 
Thank you,

In XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX, I contacted Citibank about several unrecognized charges that appeared on my online account and billing statements.
