Sub-issue: Can't close your account
Consumer complaint narrative:
On/around XX/XX/XXXX I opened an online account with Citibank, to which I deposited {$25.00}. I also opened an account with XXXX XXXX XXXX, as their bank has more locations in the XXXX area. I opened the accounts so that I would have a bank local to this area, and to deposit an inheritance from my Mother 's passing in XX/XX/XXXX. 

Needless to say, I have had nothing but issues with Citibank. First, I received the card that would not allow me to activate. When I contacted their customer service, XX/XX/XXXX, I was told the account was put on hold and closed due to them not being able to validate my information via XXXX. Citibank informed I would be receiving the refund for the deposit balance via check in the mail. I contacted XXXX and was informed that my credit report was locked, thus, the reason Citibank could not open my account. I had my report unlocked at that time. Later this same week I received my XXXX XXXX XXXX account information. 

Several weeks go by and I had not received the refund from Citibank, so I contacted them again, XX/XX/XXXX, and was informed by a customer service representative that they could not locate the account or a deposit refund. I asked to be transferred to a supervisor who also attempted to locate my account, only to scroll down and find that it was on the next page of their information. He put me on hold for about 30 minutes, telling me they had not yet closed the account due to a hold placed on the account, but he would look into and ensure it was closed and I received a refund. He said they would contact me if anything further is needed, and that I would be receiving my refund in 5-7 days. 

Today, XX/XX/XXXX - Still no refund. Contacted Citibank, and they informed that this account is with the fraud department and would need to be closed thru them. I am beyond mortified and the level of customer service provided by this institution and their lack of support in that regard. I am not certain I'll ever receive a refund but wanted to file a formal complaint, as this, in more ways than one, infringes on basic consumer rights. NOTE : Each step of the way, I have verified my idendity on many occasions SSN, DOB, Address, Mother 's Maiden name ... feels like they even want my first born! It's crazy that I have to verify this information OVER, and OVER, and OVER, and OVER throughout 1 phone call with 1 person.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I just finished speaking with your agency and had your agency review my complaints and Citis responses. Your agency agreed with me they were able to see Citi clearly ignoring my demands to provide verification and proof. Please note this as to the record.A simple response providing no evidence to support their allegations is proof Citi is attempting to falsify allegations on their behalf in retaliation.To date no proof has been given as has been repeatedly requested and repeatedly ignored and denied.The alleged account has NEVER BEEN VERIFIED and they know this and is why they continue to falsify reports and mislead corporations into believing theyve satisfied requirements which theyve in fact failed to provide and instead issue a standard letter used to cause diversion so that they not be discovered for their illegal acts. They were asked to provide proof of mailing correspondence since they claimed a certain address but did not provide this and ignored due to obviously not having any proof otherwise.I never had a physical card from Citi to this alleged account and is also why I demanded proof. Currently Citi is enthralled in a multitude of lawsuits and class actions due to their unethical and illegal business practices. The writing theyve provided in response here to my past complaint are clear attempts to cause diversions knowing they do not have any proof of this alleged account and are instead attempting to blackmail and extort funds for their alleged account that has never been verified.

Not only has Citi severely been found to breach contracts with its clients by a court of law, but theyve not learned their lesson since they continue to do so ... Your agency also found them guilty of the exact same unethical unlawful business practices. Clearly they view their illegalities with normalcy.You may read for yourself where a pdf  from the government is included on their deceptive business practices they were also found guilty of as folllows : CFPB Orders Citibank to Pay {$700.00} XXXX  in Consumer Relief for Illegal Credit Card Practices XX/XX/XXXX Millions of Consumers Harmed by Banks Deceptive Marketing and Unfair Billing of Credit Card Add-On Products and Services, and Other Unlawful Practices WASHINGTON, D.C. The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) has ordered Citibank , N.A . and its subsidiaries to provide an estimated {$700.00} million in relief to eligible consumers harmed by illegal practices related to credit card add-on products and services. Roughly 7 million consumer accounts were affected by Citibanks deceptive marketing, billing, and administration of debt protection and credit monitoring add-on products. A Citibank subsidiary also deceptively charged expedited payment fees to nearly 1.8 million consumer accounts during collection calls. Citibank and its subsidiaries will pay {$35.00} XXXX in civil money penalties to the CFPB. 

We continue to uncover illegal credit card add-on practices that are costing unknowing consumers millions of dollars, said CFPB Director XXXX XXXX. In our four years, this is the tenth action weve taken against companies in this space for deceiving consumers. We will remain on the lookout for similar conduct and will address it as we find it. 

Citibank , N.A . is a national bank and insured depository institution. Citibank, as well as its subsidiaries Department Stores National Bank, and CitiXXXX XXXX Services , Inc. ( USA ), marketed or offered credit card add-on products to consumers nationwide. From at least XXXX through XXXX, Citibank actively marketed and enrolled consumers in five debt protection add-on products : AccountCare, Balance Protector, Credit Protection, Credit Protector, and Payment Safeguard. These products promised to cancel a consumers payment or balance, or defer the payment due date, if the consumer experienced certain hardships, such as job loss, disability, hospitalization, and certain life events, such as marriage or divorce. Citibank also marketed and sold other add-on products  XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, and Citi Credit Monitoring Services that offered credit-monitoring or credit-report-retrieval services. Citibank also offered Watch-Guard Preferred, a  wallet-protection service that notified credit and debit card issuers if the consumers reported a card lost or stolen. 

Deceptive Marketing The Bureau found that Citibank or its service providers marketed these products deceptively during telemarketing calls, online enrollment, point-of-sale application and enrollment at retailers, or when enrolled consumers later called to cancel certain products. For example, confusing text on pin-pad offer screens at the point of sale increased the likelihood that consumers applying for credit cards at a retailer would not realize they were both applying for credit and purchasing debt-protection coverage. These illegal practices affected an estimated 4.8 million consumer accounts. Among other things, Citibanks misleading or illegal marketing or retention practices included : Misrepresenting cost and fees for coverage : In some cases, telemarketers misrepresented or did not inform the consumer about the cost of the products. In certain telemarketing scripts, Citibank instructed telemarketers to claim a blanket free 30-day trial period, when Citibank still charged consumers during the initial 30 days of membership. In other instances, Citibank failed to inform consumers that they would be billed after the 30-day trial period if they did not cancel the product. Citibank also told some consumers they could avoid the fee by paying their balance in full by the due date. But to avoid the fee, consumers had to pay off the balance before the end of their billing cycle so that there would be no balance on the account when billing statements went out. 
Misrepresenting benefits of some products : For consumers who signed up for a credit-monitoring product, Citibank claimed the fraud alert service on credit card accounts would alert them of fraudulent purchases. In fact, the credit-monitoring product only provided alerts to changes in a consumers credit file maintained by major reporting companies, not at the transaction level. Citibank also misled consumers in telemarketing calls and in online marketing about the credit score benefit. It told consumers the credit score was generated from all the three major credit reporting companies, when in reality the score was generated by a third-party vendor. 
Illegal practices in the enrollment process : During telemarketing calls, Citibanks nonbank subsidiary, XXXX XXXX XXXX , XXXX. ( USA ), used illegal practices to enroll consumers in these products. That company used leading questions to obtain billing authorizations from consumers for certain add-on products. It also enrolled some consumers without any billing authorization or by construing ambiguous responses during calls for a billing authorization as permission for enrollment, and then charged consumers for the products. 
Misrepresenting or omitting information about eligibility for coverage : In some instances, consumers disclosed information to Citibank indicating that they would be ineligible for certain benefits. However, Citibank failed to inform them that they would be ineligible to receive the product benefits and still enrolled them in the product. 
Unfair Billing Practices Under federal law, in order for Citibank or its vendors to obtain consumers credit information to provide the credit-monitoring or credit-report-retrieval services for certain add-on products, consumers generally must authorize access to that information. In many instances, however, Citibank billed consumers for these products without having the authorization necessary to perform the credit-monitoring and credit-report-retrieval services. In other cases, Citibank or its vendors could not provide the promised services for other reasons, such as when the consumers information could not be found in the consumer reporting companies files. As a result, Citibank : Charged consumers for benefits they did not receive : Citibank charged consumers whose authorizations were not in order or who could not receive the credit monitoring or other benefits. The company continued to charge consumers for services they were not receiving, in some cases for the entire time the consumer had the product. 
Failed to provide product benefits : Consumers may have been under the impression that their credit was being monitored for fraud and identity theft, when, in fact, these services were either not being performed at all, or were only partially performed. 
Citibank engaged in these unfair billing practices from at least XXXX through XXXX. About 2.2 million consumer accounts were improperly billed product fees while not receiving the full product services. 

Deceptive Collection Practices When collecting payment on delinquent retailer-affiliated credit card accounts, Citibank offered consumers the option to pay by phone using a checking account, so the payment would post to the account on the same day. There was a {$14.00} fee associated with using this option. Citibank misled consumers by not disclosing the purpose of the expedited payment fee. It misrepresented the payment fee as a processing fee and did not explain that the fee was to post payment to the account on the same day it was made rather than a fee to allow payment. Citibank also failed to disclose other no-cost payment alternatives. The company charged the fee even though it was rarely in the consumers interest to pay the fee so that the payment would post on the same day. 

Enforcement Action Pursuant to the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act, the CFPB has the authority to take action against institutions engaging in unfair, deceptive, or abusive practices, or other violations of federal consumer financial law. This is the tenth action the Bureau has taken against companies for illegal practices in the marketing or administration of add-on products and services. The CFPBs order requires that Citibank : Provide {$700.00} XXXX in relief to roughly 8.8 million consumer accounts : Citibank must provide approximately {$470.00} million in consumer relief to about 4.8 million consumer accounts as a result of the deceptive marketing or retention practices. It also must pay approximately {$190.00} million to roughly 2.2 million consumer accounts that enrolled in the credit monitoring products and were charged while Citibank did not perform all of the promised services. Department Stores National Bank must provide about {$23.00} million in consumer relief to almost 1.8 million consumer accounts for  charging expedited payment fees on these delinquent accounts. 
Conveniently repay consumers : Citibank will reimburse consumers affected by these practices. Consumers who are eligible for a refund do not have to take any action to get their refund. For the unfair billing practices related to the credit-monitoring products, Citibank has completed reimbursement to eligible consumers. For eligible consumers who have not received refunds yet, Citibank will initiate and complete a remediation process to reimburse those consumers. 
End unfair billing practices : Consumers will no longer be billed for the credit monitoring products if they are not receiving the promised benefits. 
Cease engaging in illegal practices : Citibank is prohibited from marketing all add-on products by telephone or at the point of sale, or engaging in attempts to retain consumers in these products by telephone, until it submits a compliance plan to the CFPB. 
Pay a {$35.00} XXXX penalty : Citibank will make a {$35.00} XXXX penalty payment to the CFPBs Civil Penalty Fund.

The CFPB is taking this action in coordination with the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency, which is separately ordering a {$35.00} XXXX civil penalty and restitution from Citibank and Department Stores National Bank for some of the same illegal practices. 

The full text of the CFPBs consent order is available at : https : XXXX

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a credit reporting company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Problem with personal statement of dispute
Consumer complaint narrative:
This is the correspondence I sent to Citibank who still continues to not investigate their own actions and merely responds with a format letter and not a specific response to my particular personal issue : Dear Citi Card ; I am writing today because I am extremely upset with how my new secure credit card account with Citi Card has been handled and the fact that it has been closed due to an error. I have been a long-time Citibank customer and the recent actions by Citi Card are calling into question whether or not I will even continue banking at Citibank. It is my goal to lay out the issues to Citi Card in this correspondence with the success action point expected of Citi Card apologizing, reopening my account and reactivating my card. If this matter is not resolved from this correspondence, I will file various complaints, including but not limited to filing a complaint with Citibank, the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, XXXX XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX, as well as pursue all remedies afforded to me as a consumer under the laws of the state of California. 

I first came to learn of the Citi Card as a recommendation from XXXX XXXX to assist me in improving my credit history and credit score. I was excited when I was approved for a secured line of credit in the amount of {$300.00}. I made the deposit by transferring funds from my Citibank account to Citi Card. I used the card for months with no issue, always paid more than the minimum payment and watched my credit score increase. 

Then on or about XX/XX/2020, I made a payment in the amount of {$100.00}. I originally tried to do so with a live representative, but the hold time was taking too long, so I went online to make the payment. I then tried to make the payment by merely putting in my bank account information, but for some technical reason the system would only accept my payment if I linked my bank account to my Citi Card account. Although I have three ( 3 ) bank accounts with three ( 3 ) different banking institutions, I felt it mutually beneficial to link my Citibank account to my Citi Card. Here is where the problem lies, and the stories between my account and Citi Card differ but what is not disputable is that a MISTAKE was made somewhere. When I input my bank account information online, and double-checked it, the numbers were typed correctly. The system accepted the payment and a confirmation was emailed to me. Days later I received an email that seemed fraudulent that said in pertinent part : Hi, XXXX. Your recent payment of {$100.00} that was scheduled for XX/XX/2020 could not be processed. This could have occurred for various reasons.

Turns out it was not fraud so on or about XX/XX/XXXX, I went back online and hit the saved card information and once again the payment went through and a payment confirmation was emailed to me. It left a balance of about {$25.00}. All was well.

Shockingly, on or about XX/XX/XXXX, just six ( 6 ) days later I received a very disturbing correspondence that stated : Hi XXXX. We frequently review cardmember accounts a recent review of our account shows one or more late or returned payments in the past six months. Due to this, we had to close your Citi Mastercard account Needless to say, I was livid! I have only had the account for three months, paid all of my bills on time, paid more than the minimum, and never charged the full limit. I called Customer Service and spoke to several people, each knowing less than the one before. It was the worst customer service I have experienced in quite some time, of any kind. After several tries, I finally spoke to a Supervisor who identified himself as XXXX, employee ID XXXX who shared with me the payment process that has two faults. He indicated that the first try for the payment I put in 12 numbers when the bank account only has 11 numbers. He furthered that my second input was 11 numbers which was the accurate banking account number. 1 ) Most systems, if the cardholder were to possibly input the wrong information, the online payment processing system lets the cardholder know, immediately, in real time that there is an error. It will not process the information if there is any error. This did not happen. 2 ) When I went online to re do the payment, I didnt retype my card number. It was already saved in the system so all I did was resubmit the information. I didnt retype the card number. So it is my contention that the SYSTEM and not me committed an error in reversing the acceptance of the payment. Citi Cards position is that when I went online to re do the payment, I typed in 11 numbers which was the accurate number for the corresponding bank account. Whether it was 11 numbers typed in or 12 is in dispute, but what we know for a fact that is not in dispute is that the input issue was AN ACCIDENT. It was either an error on my part with typing 1 extra number or the systems part in coding an extra number of system error in the processing. Either way, the issue was an innocent mistake. To have my account closed based on a blameless mistake is ludicrous. 

Beyond the preposterous closing of a well-maintained account, Citi Cards actions in closing the account has put me in a worst position than I was in before opening said account and has caused more damage to my credit score causing it to drop 73 points!!! 

The point of applying for the card was to build my credit history and Citi Card assured me by written instrument that monthly notifications to the credit bureaus about my account would be provided to help build my credit history. Citi Mastercard further noted that by my choosing the Citi Card I would receive protection benefits, and worldwide acceptance. The goal of both parties was that opening a Citi Card would be a beneficial tool, mechanism, vehicle and platform to be of assistance, not to embark on something that was going to be gravely detrimental. This has been a horrible experience.

I am requesting Citi Card reopen my account. This has been beyond an ordeal and an unfair one at that. I will consider arbitration and other legal remedies including the possibility of filing this matter in Court in order to properly resolve the reopening my account. The only other alternative I will consider is Citi removing this account from the credit bureau reporting altogether. 

Under the circumstances, as a new business customer having suffered through this ordeal, both are viable options and the strongest solutions that would be asked for as judgment by the Courts, or via an arbitrator along with any monetary damages the Court may deem appropriate from the damage to my credit. 

During this fragile and tumultuous time, I have looked to my credit to see what lending options might be available to me. To have my score plummet so quickly and deeply has been injurious to my personal life and my small business operating options. 

Literally my payments for the Citi card were coming from my linked Citibank checking account. The irony that it is that account they " say '' they couldn't locate. The very banking account ALREADY in the system in my account!!! I didn't miss any payments, paid more than was the minimum and you closed my account and reporting it the same as you would of an account that had a poor payment or returned payments for lack of funds. THAT was not my case. I should never have been treated as such. In conclusion, this has been quite the ordeal!! Its been personally frustrating getting the run around with off-shore to on-shore assistance ; consistently inconsistent information being told to me about the appeal process and who and where I can send this correspondence. I had to do the research myself. In good faith, I opened my account with Citi because I felt I could depend on its stellar reputation, and because of my affiliation and long-standing positive relationship with its banking institution, I felt I would be treated fairly, equitably with respect and in a nondiscriminatory fashion. I found none of those characteristics to be true! And now time is of the essence. I am trying to make sure this blemish on my credit history is cleared off my record within the next 30 days and my resolution reflected on the next reporting cycle to the bureaus without the need for stronger legal intervention. I trust that this is feasible. 

Im happy to talk with you further anytime, as expeditious resolution of this urgent matter is best for both of us. 



Respectfully requested,

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX, IL XXXX XXXX Re : Billing error/fraudulent charge of {$58.00} on XX/XX/XXXX Macys Acct : XXXX XXXX XXXX Consumer Financial Protection Bureau Dear Sirs : In XX/XX/XXXX, I applied for a mortgage loan & found to my surprise that Macys had reported to the credit bureau ( s ) that I was 3 months late on a {$58.00} charge allegedly made on my Macys/XXXX  XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX. On XX/XX/XXXX, I provisionally paid {$160.00} ( {$58.00} + {$110.00} in late charges ) to stop additional fees from accruing while the billing error was being resolved. 

The MacysXXXX XXXX XXXX  on which the {$58.00} charge was allegedly made was sent to our former Florida address ( XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, FL XXXX ) ; it was not forwarded & we never received it. I have had the same Macys card for about 7 years ( Acct # XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) but it has Macys not MacysXXXX XXXX on it. 

In my initial phone complaint on XX/XX/XXXX to XXXX @ Macys, I notified them that I/we did not make such a charge & demanded that we be sent a copy of the original {$58.00} charge slip with my signature ; they stated they didnt have it! I demanded the name & contact address of the Macys supervisor in charge of the Fraud Dept. so I could send a written Notice of Billing Error ; they refused saying they couldnt give that info out! I then demanded an email address for the Macys Fraud Unit so I could document the date I notified them of the billing error ; they responded they couldnt receive emails! XXXX promised to notify Macys Fraud Investigations ( Ph : XXXX XXXX XXXX ) of my complaint & he stated that I would receive written acknowledgement of my complaint ( Still not received after 60+ days! ) & a written summary of the results of their investigation of the fraudulent charge ( Nothing received after 60+ days! ) I have made multiple phone calls in attempting to resolve this matter & restore my credit all to no avail. Here is listing of Macys contacts I have made thus far! 

Date Emp. Name Title Phone XX/XX/XXXX XXXX Cust Serv XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XXXX  Macys Credit Cust Serv XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XXXX Macys Cust Serv XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XXXX Macys Fraud Unit XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XXXX Cust Serv XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XXXX  Citibank Consumer servs XXXX XXXX XXXX ( does Macys billing ) I request that CFPB : 1 ) Help me to obtain a copy of the original XX/XX/XXXX charge receipt for {$58.00} & a detailed accounting of each late charge added to my acct ; 2 ) Help me to obtain a written record of the investigation results in this matter by the Macys Fraud Dept. 
3 ) Assist me in insuring that Macys removes the spurious {$58.00} charge from my acct, notifies the credit bureaus of the error immediately, & issues a refund of the {$160.00} I paid provisionally. 

Thank you, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
CFPB, this is my third complaint to you regarding Citi 's unfair practice towards its customer. The reasons I keep writing these complaints are : ( 1 ) I have not received a satisfactory answer and resolution from Citi, and ( 2 ) I strongly believe that this is an unfair and deceptive practice/policy of Citi that others might be victims of ( I have read similar complaints in XXXX  and CFPB ). 

Please try to put yourself in my shoes and tell me if this happens to you, it does not cause frustration and anger because you know it's a policy that victimizes the customer. 

Please read my previous complaints for details, but in a nutshell my family savings was locked on XX/XX/2020 under the excuse of " being reviewed for fraud '' and " being reviewed for closure ''. No one in the Fraud Department or Executive Response Unit ( ERU ) was able to confirm why because it is being reviewed by the " back office '' of which no one even at Citi is able to contact. They told me to wait 30-60 days for an explanation, then another 30-60 days for the account to be closed. So under this ridiculous policy, a customer can be locked out of their own money for a total of 120 days. 

It was only after multiple complaints to CFPB and XXXX  they finally released the funds. That is 63 days after many frustrating calls, emails, and complaints. Hours have been lost. Money have been lost ( I had to take a loan with transaction fee because I could not access my money ). Time have been lost. 

And the explanation Citi provided on why they close my account? Tell me if this is a satisfactory explanation : " Citibank maintains the right to close an account " ... at any time with or wihtout cause. '' We may try to notify you in advance should this be necessary, but we are not  obliged to do so. '' So it's a non-explanation explanation. So they threw their customer on the curbside because of what exactly? So Citi is saying to me : " We don't want you as a customer for reasons that we will not share with you, but we have no issue keeping your money during the long process, because we can make more money out of it for ourselves! '' Did they address the loan that I had to take? No. Did they address the lost time and potential interest? No. Not even an apology, just a cold letter with unsatisfactory explanation. 

Do they really expect me to accept this unfair treatment just because it is part of their " policy '' and " customer manual ''?

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am unable to login to the Citibank website to check my credit card balance, make payments, or manage the card at all. 

I have had a Citibank credit card for about 5 years. This past winter, in 2019, I opened a checking account with Citibank. I had so many problems opening the account, getting the debit card, registering for online banking, funding the account, that I close the checking account within 2 weeks of opening. 

This morning I received an email stating that my checking account was ready to use ( despite being closed in XX/XX/2019 ). I went to login to my Citibank account which is still used for my credit card, and the website said I needed to reset my password. When I went to reset my password I was told my account was locked. 

I first went to physical branch who told me they could not help me but that I did not have an open checking account. 

I then called the number on the back of my credit card. I was told that in order to unlock my account, I needed to provide my debit card number or account number of my checking account. The checking account has been closed for months and did not ever receive funding because of all the problems. I told Citibank that I did not have this information. The representative told me to call back when I do ( this is not an acceptable resolution ). 

At one point I was told to " reregister '' the card online. I tried to do this but the website said that the card was linked to another online account ( the locked account ).

I am willing to pay up to the {$9000.00} credit limit I had on my Costco Business credit card, but nothing more. I am a victim of identity theft,  have taken the proper procedures to let everyone know, and am not responsible for Citis mishandling of this situation.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I opened two savings accounts between XXXX and XXXX, To fund the first account, i transferred funds from my XXXX savings and I also had a partial salary deposited every week. The second account was funded with a wire transfer for {$300000.00} from XXXX XXXX. Around XX/XX/XXXX, I attempted to transfer XXXX. the transfer was held and i was told for a review which will last between 24-48 hours. once the time elapsed, I called customer service to find out the account was blocked for fraud and my online access revoked. I inquired about the steps to take to resolve the issue and i was told I had to wait for a letter in the mail that will arrive between 30-60 days which was unacceptable to me as i had urgent needs for my money. I called every day between XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX. The letter eventually arrived on the XXXX of XXXX and what the letter said was for me to call the number that i had been calling since the XXXX and that my accounts were blocked. So, after countless phone calls, two supervisors advised that i needed to go to a local branch to get my funds sooner. I live in MA where Citibank has no branches. The nearest branch is in Connecticut, 180 miles from where i live. So because i needed the funds, i agreed to drive to Connecticut to take care of the situation. by the way they blocked my account because of fraud but yet i initiated every single conversations i had with the bank. No one has called me to ask questions about the accounts, the funds, paperwork, nothing. So, before driving 180 miles to CT, I had a supervisor from the fraud department call the branch to ensure that i will not have any issues closing my accounts. The supervisor spoke to XXXX and i spoke to him as well to be assured that i could close the accounts and take my money. So I rented a car and drove the 180 miles and when I got there, The rep, XXXX XXXX, called the same fraud department that advised me to go to a branch, to have them remove the block and they refused. Citibank is holding my money under the guise of " fraud '' but on their advise, i physically drove 180 miles to a branch and they would not close my accounts or give me my money. 
Now, on Monday XX/XX/XXXX, I called again and the representative told me she could not talk to me because i was unable to verify my account numbers. Mind you i had called between XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX and me not being able to verify the account numbers was never an issue. They would normally ask other questions. Now no representatives or supervisors would talk to me about my accounts, my money until i verify account numbers I don't have and cant obtain because they blocked my access to online banking. yet again they recommended that i go to a branch to get the account numbers which is the same branch i drove 180 miles to get to and nothing was resolved. As of XXXX XXXX, I still do not have access to my {$32000.00} : Rent is due, Tuition is due, bills are due and I have no idea why my funds are being held. the last time i was able to speak to a rep, i was told to wait for a check but i was physically at a branch where they could have just cut me a cashier 's check for my money. this situation has caused me a lot of stress and aggravation. Citibank ruined the holidays for me and my family and and they are about to ruin my credit. Sadly, they just don't give a XXXX!!!

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Sub-issue: Problem with fees
Consumer complaint narrative:
Beginning in XX/XX/2019, Cit began failing to issue conditional credits for disputed transactions on my statement held me accountable for the billing dispute amounts in full in the following ways : 1. ) Citi charged me interest on the entire statement balance each month despite having paid the balance in full minus the disputed amount. Cit then proceeded to refund the interest for the disputed charges alone after finalizing the investigation and issuing permanent credits. 
2. ) Citi reported the balance including the charges in dispute to all three credit reporting agencies, as being a debt I owe.This had the additional negative effect of lowering my credit score. 
3. ) Citi repeatedly sent me notices my balance was over my credit limit, despite this only being due to the disputed transactions which Citi failed to issue conditional credits while conducting their investigation. 
4. ) While reporting and contacting Citi in regards to the billing disputes, Citi dispute resolution agents and management repeatedly argue, trying to justify why the disputed charges are valid, making broad assumptions. This process has become so mentally draining and time consuming. Citi Dispute resolution agents on several occasions have even yelled and screamed at me, placed me on extended hold times over an hour at a time waiting for a supervisor only to report there are none, hung up on repeatedly and transferred to other departments without warning simply to avoid having to correctly processing a billing dispute as required by law and the XXXX interchange agreement. It is routine to receive conflicting information as well as false and misleading information from these agents in attempts to prevent having to properly handle the dispute. 
5. ) After receiving multiple letters of the billing dispute resolution in my favor and the conditional credits being permanent, Citi will re-bill for the billing disputes. Usually they are for the identical amount disputed and labeled R- bill. Usually the re-bills are shown with the same transaction and post date. However, on at least one occasion Citi has charged me a different amount, with a different post date, for credits which they state are permanent, 3 to 4 months afterwards. Of course Citi charges interest retroactively for these re-bills which violate federal regulations, their written agreements, timelines allowed to re-bill. 

All my claims can be supported and backed as all phone interactions with Citi have been recorded which I am in possession of. I am more than happy to make these as undeniable evidence and proof of Citi 's many violations. 

These actions repeatedly show Citi has continually acted in bad faith by violating terms outlined in the member agreement.This places In addition to routinely being in breach of the contracted terms, Citi 's actions are also violates the Fair Billing Practice Laws and Deceptive Trade Laws.

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Sub-issue: Problem during payment process
Consumer complaint narrative:
I have the Best Buy Reward Zone Master Card issued by CitiBank. This card was closed in late XXXX by the credit issuer and I went to pay the full balance on XX/XX/XXXX on the website owned by CitiBank. 

I processed one payment and received one email confirmation for the full payment amount of {$440.00} -- no other emails were received from CitiBank. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I log into my checking account and see CitiBank has posted the same payment twice with different confirmation numbers. I checked my email to see only one confirm and then checked the CitiBank web portal to see TWO confirmations even though I only processed the payment. I contacted both my bank, XXXX XXXX, and the card issuer CitiBank to inform them of their error. The first agent I spoke with at CitiBank was unintelligent and told me " yep, we have the payment, it's all good! '' I insisted on speaking with a supervisor who then realized what happened and informed me of their " system error '' and they would issue a credit which would post back to my bank account in 3-4 days. Immediately after that call, because I did not trust CitiBank at this point, I also notified XXXX XXXX in the event the credit did not show up as promised. XXXX issued a " temporary courtesy credit while the matter was investigated until XX/XX/XXXX, '' this credit from XXXXXXXX XXXX  was posted to my account on XX/XX/XXXX. The credit from CitiBank did indeed post to my bank account refunding one of the two payments on XX/XX/XXXX. 

On XX/XX/XXXX I received an email correspondence from CitiBank stating they " couldn't process my payment. '' I logged into my account and see CitiBank had reversed BOTH payments -- now reflecting the card having a full balance of {$440.00}. 

I contacted CitiBank again only to become more frustrated because both agents insisted that all was fine with the account, XXXX had alerted them of the payment being returned as invalid, and they'd issued one refund so the full balance remain. I continued to tell CitiBank that was NOT correct, as the credit from XXXX was only a temporary courtesy credit and would not be valid once it reconciled that one payment was already credited back, as I'd informed XXXX XXXX that one payment ( and only one payment ) was authorized. The agent, XXXX with agent code XXXX, was incredibly rude and I asked to speak with her supervisor who also stated there was nothing more for CitiBank to do. The payments/reversals were as they should be and they could not offer any help. 

Not only would I not want to double pay a card that is closed, their system would likely have something that would alert the consumer that a payment is already pending for the SAME amount or not accept a double payment causing a negative balance on a credit card. 

As a consumer, I have spent more than an hour making more than 4 phone calls to try and resolve this ... all while CitiBank continues to collect a high interest rate daily. This behavior is abusive to consumers and there is no way I can reasonably avoid their acts of processing multiple payments and reversing them at their whim. 

I will not be processing another payment until I resolve the matter directly with XXXXXXXX XXXX and will no longer be contacting CitiBank expecting any help of any sort, as all their agents have done is cause further issues and increase my level of frustration.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Hello, On Wednesday, XX/XX/XXXX, I received an e-mail from XXXX XXXX from XXXX XXXX AAdvantage Corporate Security stating that my AAdvantage  account ( # XXXX ) was terminated. This termination e-mail included forfeiture of all membership benefits, miles, and award tickets. 

I suffered substantial financial loss as a result of this termination, including : 1 ) About XXXX XXXX  Miles - Approximate Retail Value $ 14k USD. The vast majority of these miles came from financial products ( e.g., credit card bonuses, hence why I am filing with the CFPB ), and a handful came from actually flying with XXXX. 
2 ) 2 return flights back from Hawaii, where I was on vacation with my partner - meaning that we needed to book return flights for a last minute Holiday season ticket back to New York from Hawaii. 

The termination and subsequent forfeiture of miles and the award ticket were surprising to me. The e-mail sent was vague and did not specify a specific infraction, but cited " fraud, misrepresentation, abuse, or violation of applicable rules. '' To the best of my knowledge, I did not participate in any form of fraud, misrepresentation, abuse, or violate any rules laid forth by the AAdvantage Terms and Conditions. I have attempted contact with XXXX  8+ times and have not yet received an explanation. To that end, I have filed a complaint with the DOT regarding XXXX. 

However, Citibank is also involved in this. The vast majority of my miles were earned through credit card sign-up bonuses, whose offers were sent to my postal address via USPS. I filled these offers out with my legitimate information and several times spoke with Citibank Customer Service Analysts in order to be approved for these cards. I met the requirements to earn the sign-up bonuses in a legitimate fashion. With XXXX  terminating my account, all of the bonuses I earned with Citibank are rendered void. I have attempted to contact Citibank regarding this issue, only to be told that there's nothing that they can do about it and it's all on XXXX  's end. 

However, that's misleading and fraudulent. They entered into an agreement that now I am being punished for - and I would like to seek that Citibank rectifies this by doing the following : 1 ) Working with XXXX  to reinstate my account along with my forfeited miles - they have corporate partnerships that should make this relatively straightforward. 
2 ) If the first is not possible, for Citi to award me an alternate currency for the award miles that I was not able to use - either in USD or an alternate points currency - Citi has an alternate award program TYP, that they could convert my sign-up bonuses into. 

I'm happy to provide any additional information, including correspondences, screenshots, etc. 

Thank you very much for your help in this matter. 

Best wishes, XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative: My wife and I had a Costco Anywhere VISA Business Card by Citi since XXXX, issued by Citi Cards. We both have a credit rating above 700 and have never been late on our payments. Our credit-line was over {$20000.00}. In XX/XX/XXXX, we decided to purchase a car and the dealer said it was okay to put some of it on our credit card. We only put {$5000.00} on the card, way lower than our credit-line. Days later, Citi canceled our card without any prior notification. Since we use the card in our family business, it was a great inconvenience and surprise. Moreover, the cancellation was suspicious because we have over {$750.00} cash rewards on that card. When we called to find out what happened, customer service said we had to wait for a letter but confirmed that Citi would forfeit our cash rewards that we had earned. Because of our high credit rating and patronage of over 10 years, that was an unfair business practice by Citi to act unilaterally and without notice. We asked to be reinstated but Citi refused to provide us with additional information on how to request reinstatement. Oddly, they sent advertisements of other Citi cards despite forfeiting our already-earned cash rewards. We were professional and paid off our statement at the end of the month as we have for over 10 years. Sadly, we typically would give part or all of the cash rewards we earn each year to our children to save for college. This unprofessional business practice had consequences for us in the forfeiture of the cash reward we had earned and that we had to seek a different card and, finally, our trust in Citi. We could have used a different card during that period and missed-out on other reward programs. Our reliance on Citi appears to have been misplaced.

Consumer complaint narrative: I have multiple issues on different dates with different amounts. a family member made a unauthorized purchase with XXXX with my bank debit card XXXX for {$54.00}, i immediately contacted the bank i have an account with on XX/XX/2020 and informed them of the charge and explained to them i did not authorize debit card transaction. the lady i spoke with in the dispute department was rude and told me that i will have to fill out documents explaining the dispute in detail. XX/XX/2020 i received a credit of XXXX from my bank citi bank and have yet to receive documents in the mail regarding dispute. as of XX/XX/2020 i received a letter stating my dispute has been opened and they are starting investigation. fast forward i received a letter in the mail dated XX/XX/2020 that there was insufficient evidence to conclude that the the charge was unauthorized and the bank debited my account and overdrafted my bank account. i never received the documents that was supposed to be sent explaining my dispute. when i contacted the bank, they stated i can appeal i asked the how does the process works as far as an investigation, whats the steps and the process no one could give me an answer - i asked what information was given from merchant to conclude the investigation- from my undertanding an unauthorized charge is fraudulent so what is the process how did the bank come to that conclusion, once again no one could give me an answer. i was just told to file an appeal and i would get a response in 48hrs from the time appeal was received. i faxed over documents XX/XX/2020 and called the bank XX/XX/2020 for a status of my appeal, the rep was confused and stated they dont have any doc from me via fax - i confirmed fax number and case number rep confirmed it was correct and placed me on hold and then rep stated they have received it i will be getting a response later that day or on XX/XX/2020 -- as of XX/XX/2020 i contacted them again -- no one could locate my documents and transferred me to a manager named pXXXX she pretty much talked to me like i was dumb and not knowledgeable and stated it takes 10 business days from the date they received documents and stated they don't have any docs from me -- i explained to her i have a confirmation letter that the fax was sent @ XX/XX/2020 XXXX XXXX. she stated that the reason the dispute didn't go in my favor is because the merchant never responded to them and then i asked her at that point the dispute should have went in my favor. so i asked her how does the process go if i'm the consumer and i'm calling you to tell you i didn't make this transaction that should be the end of the discussion just send me a new card and freeze my account if you have to her response was well you only have a debit card with us and those charges are treated differently while i had her on the line i had another dispute in progress with a different merchant for the date of XX/XX/2020 which i believe should be fraud. i had an arrangement with XXXX 3rd party collection agency that was cancelled as of XX/XX/2020 due to me being laid off due to covid19 and that i never received anything in writing from the company with the dates and dollar amounts as discussed, i called XX/XX/2020 to to cancel arrangement and i was told they will cancel all future pending payments. XX/XX/2020 a payment of XXXX was debited out of my account from the merchant i tried to reach out to the merchant that day and i couldn't speak to anyone i believe they are shut down due to covid 19 i called my bank that day to dispute charge. fast forward to XX/XX/2020 while i had XXXX on the line she stated that i authorized transaction by giving my card info, i explained to her again that i did not authorize that payment as of XX/XX/2020 on a recorded line and the payment was not supposed to be debited XX/XX/2020 i felt like a criminal being charged a crime when im a consumer. i told XXXX that citi was supposed to keep my money safe at this point what is the purpose of having a bank account with citi bank if every time i dispute a charge i get treated as if i'm the one who is commiting crimes. she stated yea i know its confusing and again you only have a debit card with us you don't have a real bank i stated i have a checking account number as well and she then told me that i will have to fill out docs that would be sent to my home. i asked her are you sure they will be sent out because i never received the documents for the dispute i'm appealing now. she stated how i could print the docs myself and fax them and that it could take up to 180 days. i feel like i commited a crime when i'm the victim and the dispute department needs to treat people as if they were wanted to be treated

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Issue: Advertising and marketing, including promotional offers
Sub-issue: Didn't receive advertised or promotional terms
Consumer complaint narrative:
Around XX/XX/XXXX I received an email from my Citi/Sears Mastercard for an offer of no interest for 18 months AND a 5 % statement credit for a single purchase of {$540.00} or more made outside of Sears with  an expiration of XX/XX/XXXX. On XX/XX/XXXX, I made a single purchase of {$700.00} of home heating oil thus fulfilling the offers requirements. When I received the Citi CC bill in late XXXX, they had split the charge into two amounts of {$260.00} and {$430.00}, thus making me ineligible for the offer. My first call to Citi on XX/XX/XXXX resulted in my being advised to call the merchant because " ... Citi doesn't control that ''. A call to the merchant, XXXX XXXX, on XX/XX/XXXX informed me that " We submitted a single charge of {$700.00} but sometimes the bank will split a large charge because sometimes the credit balance on the card isn't high enough '', or something to that effect. A call to Citi on XX/XX/XXXX ended after 10 minutes when the rep. hung up on me because I had difficulty understanding her accent. A subsequent call on XX/XX/XXXX lasted approximately 45 minutes during which " XXXX '' ( male ) tried to remedy the situation by telling me to have the merchant refund the charge and then resubmit it and ask the bank not to split the charge. When I pointed out that the offer had since expired, he agreed that would not work. I finally asked him " It is Citi 's fault that I did not get my 5 % statement credit so are you going to give me that {$35.00} I'm owed or not ''. He said he can't do that and I said then I will have to file a complaint and see what happens. If I may add a personal observation : I have noticed numerous examples in the past decade or so of people no longer having the ability to make decisions even when they agree with the customer. They now are put in the position of trying to convince the computer that makes the decisions that it should do what they want it to do. At some point we humans have lost control and now are secondary to the technology that now so dominates every facet of our everyday life. 
Attached is a copy of the bill ( which has already been paid in full ) showing the split charges.

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Issue: Problem with a purchase shown on your statement
Sub-issue: Credit card company isn't resolving a dispute about a purchase on your statement
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing regarding billing dispute XXXX. I am absolutely appalled at the documentation Citibank provided me. 

First of all, this item was purchased on XXXX for {$8.00}. I disputed it on XXXX for {$8.00}. In the dispute, I clearly wrote the tracking number, that the package was lost, and that I had filed a claim with the post office ( this would have been for the lost documents ). The receipt from XXXX clearly lists it is for postal service. You can see the total payment requested was {$45.00}. The amount they paid me was {$53.00}. I deposited the check on XXXX. The claim with the post office was filed on XXXX and the dispute was opened well over a week later on XXXX. I figured Citibank would work directly with XXXX since they are an authorized postal location to verify that the package was lost. XXXX provided no supporting documentation other than the receipt. Did Citibank even provide XXXX with the reason for the dispute? They should have cross-referenced the tracking number and it would have resolved the problem. And, Citibank clearly could have taken the tracking number, entered it into USPS tracking, and found that I wasnt lying about the lost package. It is a legitimate dispute. XXXX also should have done more work on their end to resolve the problem and should have provided you with better documentation. Did you even alert them to the tracking number and my filed claim with the post office? It is really listed in the dispute. 

In addition, the notes the Citibank dispute employee has written dont even make grammatical sense. It looks borderline illiterate. Why is Citibank employing people that dont even know how to properly write a sentence? 

Finally, I literally dont understand why I wasnt notified about this problem months ago. I could have gotten Citibank supporting documentation of the claim with the post office. It is Citibank 's ethical responsibility to follow up on disputes. Then, when Citibank paid it out and I realized they ( XXXX ) were actually reimbursed for the postage as well and not cross referencing my dispute with Citibank, I could have withdrawn it. Why in the world would Citibank issue me a credit, also pay the merchant, and then take the amount and write it off? Why is Citibank issuing me a credit, then a conditional credit, then a permanent credit with no documentation required? This implies Citibank has followed up with the merchant and they agree with the dispute, which Citibank did and still failed to reverse it. And, if the Citibank employee coded that what I did was against the law, why on earth would Citibank not alert me to the problem? I listed it as goods not expected/received. You list examples of goods/services not as expected on your website as receiving something different than what was ordered, being unhappy with the service, the terms and conditions of the sale are not met, or ordering a specific brand and receiving counterfeit items. If a customer is doing something incorrectly, especially if you are going to say it is illegal, Citibank has an obligation to alert the customer and not let it pile up. If the package was not delivered as agreed under the conditions of priority mail, it is totally valid. The only reason why I even found out about this was when I withdrew every dispute with XXXX  for the year because I wanted them to take accountability for false advertising, not properly processing refunds, and failing to issue refunds. I have addressed this in another CFPB complaint, XXXX is reimbursing me within the next week, they are working on fixing the problems within the store, especially the problems within their meat department chain-wide. I went as far to go to three different stores, took pictures of every step, and e-mailed it all to their district manager. Now he also gets to deal with this... 

Citibank 's dispute process totally needs to be reevaluated. I have never been so disillusioned with a company in my life.

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/2020 I have opened Citi Bank account package by phone. It had an offer of giving {$500.00} signup bonus in case of depositing XXXX dollars within 30 days and maintaining money during 60 days ( {$400.00} bonus ), and also for direct deposit each months during two months ( {$100.00} bonus ). 

I correctly spelled my name and other credentials but Citi representative had made mistakes 1 ) In my 1st name he made mistakes in two ( 2 ) letters 2 ) In my email adding " f '' to my email address before @, so I could not receive important information I have discovered error 1 ) in the package of documents which Citi had sent to me shortly after account opening. As it was requested I had sent by mail W9 form, copy of my ID and signature card. This information was received by CitiBank as it was confirmed today ( XX/XX/XXXX ). When I found problem with my 1st name I immediately contacted Citi to fix the error, however it took few weeks to do so. I made direct deposit to my new Citi account and deposited {$15000.00} in proper time range to be qualified for bonus. 

During usage of my account I had found that it is blocked for any outcoming debits. I had not received any warning from Citi by mail or email about that. Spending several hours on phone I managed to find out that Citi needs copy of my ID and SSN to verify account. As it was sensitive information I requested Citi Bank to provide XXXX   form so I could upload my documents, however, I had never received this form to my email. After waiting hours on a phone me and Citi representative figured out that email in the Citi system was wrong. It was written incorrectly by Citi representative who opened account by phone for me. As a result today I was informed by Citi representative, whom I called to ask again about XXXX  form that Citi had not received my SSN and ID and going to close the account and return deposit by check. Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Sub-issue: Problem with fees
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/2020 the XXXX  dollar annual fee for my CitiBank XXXX XXXX Platinum Select Card post to my account. On XXXX XXXX I contacted Citibank 's Consumer Credit Division to ask if it was too late to cancel the card and have the annual fee refund. The Citi representative replied that it was not too late to have the annual fee refunded if I canceled the card, as Citi would refund an annual fee as long as the card was canceled within 60 days of the fee posting. Given that information, I asked and was approved to close my Citibank XXXX  Platinum Select on XX/XX/XXXX. When I noticed that the annual fee had not been removed from my account the following day, I again called Citibank and was informed on XX/XX/2020 by another representative that the fee would be removed as I had cancelled within Citi 's 60 day refund window. I assumed the matter was closed and did not monitor the account further. 

On XX/XX/2020 I received an email, noting that I had a XXXX  dollar past due payment on my Citibank XXXX  Platinum Select Credit Card. After verifying that the fee was in fact still on my account, I attempted to contact Customer Service with seven separate calls. I was placed on hold for more than two hours for two of the first six calls. For four of the first six calls, the automated system ended my call during my wait period with no explanation. I was finally about to speak to a Citi customer service representative on my seventh attempt. The representative informed me that she could not remove the annual fee from my account, as Citi had recently changed its annual fee refund policy, saying that while it had previously been 60 days from the fee posting it was now 37 days. I pointed out to the representative that was not what I had been told when I cancelled the card, and noted that if I had known I would need to pay the annual fee regardless, I would have at least chosen to keep the card for the additional year to take advantage of the benefits. I also pointed out to the representative that no where in Citi 's Card Member Agreement do they define a specific timeline for how long a client has to request a refund after an annual fee posts to their account. I also pointed out that I had never received any notification regarding Citi 's refund policy change. Most importantly I felt it was completely unjust that I am expected to pay an annual fee for benefits I will not be able to use, as I had already cancelled the card based on different advice.

Citibank has several credit card products that reward spending on them with XXXX XXXX miles. I have used their cards extensively the last several years and have accrued a significant number of miles in the AAdvantage program. 

XXXX  has recently closed my account with them alleging " accrual of ineligible miles and benefits ; through fraud, misrepresentation and/or abuse of the AAdvantage Program. ''  I have done no such thing and have only earned XXXX  miles through legitimate spending on Citibank credit cards. 

Neither company has responded to my requests for more information regarding the alleged fraud and by closing my account they have effectively robbed me of over {$15000.00} of accumulated miles. I used my Citibank cards in good faith and expected them and their partners to hold up their end of our agreement. Citi is responsible for the companies that they choose to partner with on financial products and it should not be up to me to chase down fraud claims when all the points were awarded from Citi. 

I seek immediate reinstatement of my XXXX  account or fair monetary compensation for the value of the miles in the account.

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX I received an email from XXXX XXXX " XXXX XXXX '' telling my my XXXX frequent flyer account had been terminated. The reason was vague, multiple choice and more of a form letter that anything specific. At the same time they canceled 3 flights of a set I was about to start taking on XX/XX/XXXX. 

I had accumulated XXXX miles in this XXXX account. This from a combination of credit card offers, direct spend on these credit cards and yes, some miles from 2 specific revenue flights. The flights that were canceled has cost an additional XXXX total from my XXXX account. 

On to the Citi part. From some internet research about this issue, it appears that XXXX  is doing this to many " customers ''. The consensus is apparently that I obtained too many credit cards ( and associated bonus miles ) from Citi. Their belief is that using only Citi 's most strict rules, you can only get 3 or so credit cards in a 2 year period. Offers that Citi sends through the USPS mail have less strict restrictions and it is easy to obtain more than the limits XXXX  is applying. 

In short, Citi approved " too many '' credit cards for me and Citi 's partner, XXXX XXXX, thought that my count was too high. Without warning or recourse, they closed my account. Citi provided me with generous credit card sign up bonuses that were subsequently taken away by their partner, XXXX. XXXX believes it can do anything it wants with its program and for any reason. Citi does not provide a warning during the application process and somehow happily allows customers to sign up for too many ( in XXXX  's eyes ).

The frustrating part about this is that Citi can claim it was XXXX  committing this foul, where XXXX   makes vague claims and the bottom line is it thinks Citi gave out too many credit cards with bonuses. 

I suspect XXXX  sold these miles to Citi. Citi issues them to me after meeting various financial obligations ( a significant cost to me ), then XXXX  takes them away? What kind of scam is this? 

I will note, also, that Citi continues to offer XXXX XXXX credit cards to  customers with XXXX  mile bonuses. I still don't see a warning about XXXX  's " right '' to take them away as they please.

Consumer complaint narrative:
This regarding dispute number XXXX. 

The purchase price for this item was {$27.00} on XX/XX/2020. I disputed {$9.00} on XX/XX/2020 due to the item not arriving within the advertised time ( was advertised expedited shipping ). and a permanent credit was issued on XX/XX/2020, although a conditional credit for dispute showed up on my transaction history and my statement. 

The seller agreed to remove the {$9.00} charge if the negative feedback I left was removed. I told her I wasn't removing it because the review was accurate. She then contacted XXXX and they removed the feedback because the item was delivered, even though it clearly was not within the advertised timeframe. The seller clearly had the opportunity to respond to the feedback, apologize for the delay, blame it on the post office, and say she was giving me a refund. She also claimed I didn't pick it up the day before. The post office never tried to deliver it the day before despite the postal history summary ; the package did not need to be signed for. The post office messed up. I have repeatedly tried to contact the post office about this problem through their website and by phone to find out why this wasn't properly delivered and I have not heard back from them. You can reference the tracking number by going to USPS,  XXXX. 

It would have made her look better as a seller than a 100 % positive rating. I'll never believe XXXX 's rating system again. 

She also replied to me through XXXX 's messaging system that my feedback was unfair and was going to be bad karma. I complained to XXXX  about removing my feedback and the seller 's unprofessional comments through messaging, and they apologized and stated they would directly address her behavior. I also filed a XXXX   report against XXXX for removing accurate feedback as well as an attorney general report with the state of California. I have had other issues with XXXX  as well much like this one. Through the XXXX, they also apologized and issued a {$10.00} credit for me to keep shopping with them. All of this is on file with the AG 's office in California. 

I have e-mailed the supporting documentation for the refund to billing disputes on XX/XX/2020. I need Citibank to be clear that this dispute was not coded as mispresented. The seller clearly offered a refund, I had to dispute the item because of her tone ( I was concerned she wasn't going to issue the refund despite the agreement ), and either way, her negative feedback was removed. I literally can not believe she tried to renegotiate a better rating for removing the shipping fee. In addition, she can clearly obtain a refund on the shipping fee through the post office.

Plus, Citibank has been terrible with their dispute process on my account, so I need certainty. 

I am including all supporting documentation. If Citibank needs additional documentation, I will get them what they need.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Report provided to employer without your written authorization
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/2020, I requested a credit limit increase on my Costco Citi card. I requested a limit equal to that which I have on my American Express card, about double the current limit on my Costco Citi card. I have had the Citi card for several years and have a 100 % on-time, in-full payment history. 

On Citi 's website, it states : " Once you submit your request, well need to obtain a credit bureau report. '' At no point, either in full-size or small print, does it provide that this inquiry will be a hard pull. I have recently requested my credit limits raised on other cards -- no company ever performed a hard pull. I consented to a soft pull of my credit report. I did not and would not have consented to a hard pull just to raise my credit limit. 

XXXX  's blog does a good job of laying out the commonly understood differences between hard pulls and soft pulls : " A hard credit inquiry occurs when a potential lender examines your credit report and uses that information to decide whether to extend an offer for credit. For instance, if you apply for a home mortgage or a car loan, your lender will make a hard inquiry of your credit to help determine if you qualify for the loan. A soft credit inquiry, on the other hand, is a more routine check that can be done without your permission. A common example of a soft inquiry is when a lender youre currently doing business with checks your credit to make sure youre still creditworthy. You can also trigger a soft inquiry yourself if you check your own credit. '' ( https : //XXXX ) Citi is a bank with which I have a current business relationship. I was not applying for a new loan or mortgage with Citi, merely seeking to increase the credit on a preexisting credit card. When I accepted that Citi would look into my credit when considering an increase, it was based on the reasonable and commonplace understanding that a soft pull would be performed because of the context of the existing relationship. Citi has the lower barrier to avoid this kind of miscommunication, as Citi could easily modify the language on its website to specify the type of credit inquiry ( a hard pull, rather than a soft ) and could provide fine print regarding the ramifications of a hard pull to advise consumers. I have reviewed other complaints in the CFPB system and see that I am not the first Citi customer to have been surprised by a hard pull. 

As a result of Citi 's unauthorized hard pull, my credit has now dropped from " excellent '' to " good. '' This has occurred as we are trying to raise our credit to buy a home -- the only reason I was looking for a credit increase was to shrink my utilization ratio. I attempted to resolve the issue with Citi 's customer support, but unfortunately, the representatives were patronizing and not helpful. I am a reasonably informed consumer, with the additional benefit of having worked in contract law and with the Fair Credit Reporting Act. The language as it stands on Citi 's website is not sufficient for consumers to provide informed consent for a hard credit pull.

Sub-issue: Account status incorrect
Consumer complaint narrative:
This began when I contacted XXXX  XXXX XXXX in XX/XX/XXXX regarding overdraft fees. I requested that my account not accept charges that are above the current balance, and the only way to do so was for switching to a XXXX  ' account. The representative stated that no difference will be noticed with my current activity other than writing paper checks, which I had never done with my personal account for over 5 years. 

I accepted to change of my personal checking account to XXXX. ' On XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX XXXX processed an auto ACH for {$130.00} without any issues. On XX/XX/XXXX CITI attempted to withdraw an ACH in the amount of {$250.00} but it was denied. I was not notified until a week later ( XX/XX/XXXX ) when a CITI representative contacted me asking for a payment. I submitted a debit card transaction to CITI and contact XXXX to inquire about the reasoning behind the charge not going through. XXXX notified me that CITI processes ACH as paper checks ( first time I was aware ) and therefore rejected ( prior XXXX rep. told me not to worry as things will continue as is ). 

When I submitted my {$250.00} debit card payment to CITI on XX/XX/XXXX, I asked the representative if I have any other payment I must make, and he assured me all is up to date and no other payments are needed. 

**NOTE : I am on a pay-off payment plan with CITI since XX/XX/XXXX. They set me up on a no interest 60 month plan to pay off my debt. The agreed amount is {$250.00} due by the XXXX of every month. When I enrolled, my account was approaching late status, so I opted into this, and clarified with a representative if I have to pay off my late payment amount or focus on XXXX, the rep told me that I will NOT need to worry about the late payment and it will not affect my report to the credit bureau because I am now enrolled in a payment plan, so essentially pay XXXX starting the following XXXX and 30 days beyond that then it will be late ( I have a copy of the chat transcript with agent ID clearly stating not to worry about late payment reports ). 

In XXXX of XXXX, I was alerted that I have a late payment in my credit report from XX/XX/XXXX from CITI. I contacted CITI and they stated that my account was carrying the late payment balance from the moment I enrolled in XX/XX/XXXX, but the represntative never stated my account was ever late for the past 2 years ( it was hidden not even on the front end website ). Because this was carrying over apparently, 1 day past my due date and it triggered a late payment report. 

I disputed the to both CITI and three credit bureaus multiple times with sufficient evidence regarding my new checking account issue, chat transcript from CITI representative, but due to some fine print that I attempted to clarify with a representative ( who explicitly stated not to worry about late payments ) the report is considered accurate. 

I also then realized that as of today, the carry over balance of XXXX ( from XX/XX/XXXX ) is no longer in my account. Somehow my the balance was paid off, but other than the two payments ( XX/XX/XXXX which was 'rejected ' ) and XX/XX/XXXX I never made double payment. 

I checked my bank and see that it was indeed withdrawn and debited on the correct date, but CITI still shows it as returned. 

I then created a new dispute discussing how this carry over balance was no longer in my account because it was indeed debited on the correct date, but yet again they concluded the late payment as accurate.

I asked them to provide proof of me signing up for this when at the time I probably had a {$100.00} balance in which I would not need any help with makign this payment due to the minimal amount of my payment. So to this date I keep going back and forth and the last response was that they could not provide proof of me signing up for this service. So my question is why do they not refund me all of the money if they can not prove I signed up. I did not sign up for this and am demanding a refund for all of those years of them charging me per month for a service I did not sign up for. Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Sub-issue: Credit card company won't work with you while you're going through financial hardship
Consumer complaint narrative: I have been on hold to with Shop Your Way Sears ( aka Citi ) to suspend my payments due to Corona related income reduction for about 3 hours. Someone finally picked up and told me that if I place my card on forbearance my account will be closed. I asked how long the forbearance would be for and she told me I could not be given that information unless I was willing to close my account and that it would not be reopened ever. She then put me on hold again with dead air appearing to make it look as though I'd been disconnected. Finally, she returned to tell me I was being put on hold again awaiting talking with an account manager. My experience with this makes it clear that this credit card company is resentful in providing forbearance as the subtext of the conversation is actually a threat of forbidding future credit and making it so onerous it would be seemingly impossible to get done without and extensive time investment. I do not think it is the intention of the Care Act to treat people as bad credit risks and or make it impossible to later procure credit and require enormous effort to exercise the benefits it offers. This credit card company needs to immediately institute and easily accessible online application, complete with all details of how long the forbearance will be and how the paused payments will be handled once the forbearance is over. While writing this I finally was given a person to speak with who then told me at this point I could have my account shut down with no information on what that would mean and how it would impact me or my credit or I could call back at some future date and wait on hold again for many hours to see if their management had made decisions and made actual forbearance options available. Clearly, this company does not want to play, or comply with the spirit of the Care Act and is willing to make it impossible for people to benefit by it.
