During my trip gallons of rain water leaked into the cab within minutes, soaking myself and my personal belongings including my laptop. I had to pull over and stay in XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX in Virginia as it was not safe to continue driving in that condition. I returned the truck on XX/XX/XXXX at a XXXX in XXXX   XXXX  and they were closed because it was Sunday. I left the keys in the drop box. I made a phone call to XXXX  on XX/XX/XXXX to explain the situation and they stated the truck I had rented had not been checked in yet, however I would have to go online and fill out a report customer service form. I filled out the report customer service from on XX/XX/XXXX. It states on XXXX 's website they will respond in two business days. They responded on XX/XX/XXXX for me to call the claims department. I contacted the claims department on XX/XX/XXXX, the same date I received the email and explained to them what happened. I have not received any further correspondence from XXXX regarding this matter. On XX/XX/XXXX, I opened a dispute with CITI claiming goods/services not as expected, and received a conditional credit. On XX/XX/XXXX, the conditional credit was reversed due to a ruling in the merchants favor based on the fact XXXX claimed I had never contacted them. In order to reopen the case CITI requested the details and date of each contact made by the merchant as well as their attempt to resolve the matter. On XX/XX/XXXX, I sent them documentation, phone records, and copies of emails in my defense to prove that I made a good faith attempt to resolve the issue with the merchant. CITI also wanted proof of what was expected vs what was received. Examples they asked for would be a sales slip, certificate of quality, newspaper advertisement, or an itemized bill. On XXXX XXXX, I sent CITI a newspaper article where they stated " XXXX trucks are one of the cleanest and best maintained rental truck fleets on the road. '' It also stated " Every vehicle undergoes a ten point quality inspection to ensure proper fluid levels, tire pressure, and other necessary elements for a reliable safe travel '' As previously noted the XXXX damage inspection indicated damage to the front top of the vehicle causing gallons of water to leak into the cab within minutes. This truck was rented out with XXXX 's knowledge it was not in safe and reliable condition. It is safe to assume that when one rents a truck it shouldn't leak so profusely that you would need to pull over and get a hotel. I have clearly complied with CITI 's request for proof. CITI then completely closed the case in favor of the merchant stating I was unable to prove what was expected vs what was received, when in fact I sent them an abundance of proof. It should have been clearly decided in my favor as I was given a XXXX truck that was unsafe to drive. 
CITI reposted the balance of XXXX without any explanation on XX/XX/XXXX, prior to hearing back from the merchant. The merchant has responded on XX/XX/XXXX and the case has been pending since. I have asked for this charge to be removed from my account as the dispute is still pending, and they have removed the balance.

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Issue: Problem with a purchase shown on your statement
Sub-issue: Credit card company isn't resolving a dispute about a purchase on your statement
Consumer complaint narrative:
I bought two airline tickets amounting to {$1200.00} from the travel agency, XXXX, using my Citicard Mastercard. I bought the tickets ONLY because of XXXX explicitly advertised 24 hour cancellation policy ( documentation submitted to Citicard ), which advertised that I could easily cancel flights within 24 hours of booking by paying a nominal fee ( documentation submitted to Citicard ). When I called XXXX within 3 hours of purchasing the ticket ( documentation submitted to Citicard ), I was directed to the user agreement and told that canceling tickets within 24 hours would be {$200.00} per ticket ( documentation submitted to Citicard ). {$200.00} per ticket is not a nominal fee ; their user agreement fees ( $ XXXX/ticket ) flatly contradicts their advertised fees ( nominal fee ). Because the original purchase was made under false advertisement, I thereafter initiated a cancellation of the ticket ( documentation submitted to Citicard ). Given that XXXX engaged in false representation to get me to purchase the ticket in the first place, and given that I clearly cancelled the flight well before the departure date, I should in no way be responsible for the full cost of two unused tickets, {$1200.00}. 

P. 57 of the published Mastercard Chargeback Guide ( https :  XXXX  ), details the conditions under which a cardholder dispute chargeback may be processed. The Chargeback Conditions for Goods or Services Were Either Not as Described or Defective are : the cardholder contacted the issuer claiming all of the following. 

( 1 ) The cardholder engaged in the transaction. ( I meet this condition - documentation submitted ) ( 2 ) The cardholder contacted the merchant, or attempted to contact the merchant, to resolve the dispute. ( I meet this condition - documentation submitted ) ( 3 ) The merchant refused to adjust the adjust the price or issue a credit. ( I meet this condition - documentation submitted ) And one of the following.

( 1 ) The merchant did not honor the terms and conditions of the contract with the cardholder including, but not limited to, 100 % money back guarantee, written promises, or return policy. ( I meet this condition - documentation submitted, showing the merchant did not honor their advertised 24 hour cancellation policy, as it contradicts the user agreement that I was made to uphold ) Time Frame : Between 15 and 120
calendar dates form the cancellation date of the goods or services. ( I meet this condition - documentation submitted ) Despite the fact that I submitted documentation of how each Chargeback Condition was met, Citibank ruled in favor of the merchant initially simply because the merchant responded with proof that I had in fact made the purchase ( a fact that was never in dispute ) and reversed their temporary credit. When I reinitiated the investigation, Citibank responded with the statement that they could not rule in my favor unless I could provide proof that the merchant explicitly agreed to credit the charge back to me, which they never agreed to do. I have relaunched the investigation thereafter and I have no confidence that Citibank will fairly adjudicate this case and protect me as a consumer.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I used my Citi DoubleCash credit card to purchase tickets from XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX in the amount {$890.00} to the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX in XXXX Texas ( billed as XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX CA ). The event took place on XX/XX/XXXX. 

Upon arriving at the venue and proceeding to my seats I found that they were obstructed by on overhead seating section overhang, and by a large support beam directly in front of the seats. I was not able to view the game. 

I contacted XXXX and they said that all sales are final and they do not give refunds. 

I opened a dispute with Citibank and they proceeded to close the investigation without obtaining any further evidence from the merchant. I mailed them evidence of my purchase and the seating obstructions which were not listed in the sale. I included an email receipt, the seating map provided by XXXX, and photographs of the obstructions from the seats. 

After submitting this evidence, Citibank responded that We are unable to proceed with this dispute because you accepted and used the service after learning that the accommodations were not what you originally agreed upon. While we can understand your desire to obtain a credit to your account, we can not mandate that the merchant issue a credit. Our investigation remains closed. 

I do not accept that the service/goos were delivered as agreed when I purchased then. It is not possible to know that my seats were obstructed and therefor not what I originally agreed upon until after I had entered the venue to take my seats. I do not accept that there is no recourse that Citibank can take on my behalf. 

Please help me resolve this issue by insisting that Citibank reopen the dispute and request a chargeback to XXXX for the goods/services that were not as agreed upon. 

Thank You!

Then on XX/XX/XXXX, I get a letter from Citibank saying that my account is closing due to suspicious activity and I will be receiving a check in at most 2 weeks. I called the number in the letter and they kept saying they didn't know what the problem was nothing was showing up and that I need to go into a branch to get the information I need or I wait for the check. So I wait every day checking the mail to see if the check arrived, 2 weeks pass, no check, I give them a week because I'm nice, that week passes still no check. I call the fraud department and they tell me to go into a Citibank and get help there. I do that and this very sweet lady helps me and basically says that I should go to the branch where I opened the account or call the number again and ask them to resend my check. I call them they resend my check, I wait for the check, no check, I call them again, verify all my information, the check is resent, I wait for the check still no check. I call in for the fourth time, all the information is still correct, the check is resent and I wait and to no one 's surprise, there's no check. I try for the 5th time and i said if this doesn't work I'm going to the branch where I opened the account. Next thing I know it XX/XX/XXXX, I'm XXXX and I'm at a Citibank with my mom and are talking to a woman who apologizes and says she can't really help and that we have to call the fraud department. Which brings us to 3 weeks ago, when I called the fraud department and they had told me that a check was never ever sent out to me and that a check will be sent to me and I'll receive a check in the mail in about 2 weeks, it's almost XX/XX/XXXX and I still don't have my {$3100.00} that I've been waiting for almost a year for. I have been kind and patient and calm, but after waiting for almost a year this whole thing is really frustrating me.

I have been attempting to deal with Macy 's with regards to a late payment being reported on my credit report. This reporting is for the month of XX/XX/2019 and is not 100 % accurate. Therefore, I have been asking cordially that they remove this from my credit report.

I have informed them as a victim of bank fraud my accounts were temporarily frozen until it got sorted out, this caused a delay in the Macy 's payment. They are unwilling to look at the facts or provide a written justification for this late payment. I have impeccable credit history and Macy 's is ruining my ability to obtain favorable credit terms, causing sleepless nights, aggravation, stress, and inability to secure mortgage funding. Credit reporting has to be 100 % accurate and representative of a consumers ability to pay, and the late payment reporting does not accurately sum up the entire story of what happened. It simply reads I missed a payment when in fact, the payment was made but was compromised due to bank fraud that was happening to my account. Macy 's never notified me that the payment was past due, even though they had 30 days to do so before damaging my credit score.

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/19, purchased a dining room table in the amount of {$1100.00} from XXXX XXXX ( XXXX, FL location ) using my Citicard. Company delivered furniture on XX/XX/19 in damaged condition. Per company 's policy, I immediately took pictures of damage and filed a claim online ( claim # XXXX ). Over the next two months, the company made 3 separate appointments to repair table ; only to not show up ( or even call to cancel appointment on two occasions ). Simultaneous with complaint, I notified Citicard that the charge of {$1100.00} is being disputed until the table has been repaired. Citicard issued temporary credit. When XXXX XXXX was unable to repair table ( or even show up to do so ), they appeared at my house without notice on XX/XX/19 to pick up the table. I then received a copy of a memo from XXXX XXXX ( ref XXXX ) advising " credit memo to pick table up. '' However, apparently XXXX XXXX never coordinated that credit memo with Citicard. 
Citicard issued a memo on XX/XX/19 advising " regrettably, we are unable to assist you with this dispute. '' I sent a detailed letter to Citicard at their XXXX XXXX, SD address ( only address supplied by them ) detailing the nature of my complaint and again requesting their assistance since they reversed the credit to my account. Never received a response to this memo or my other written communications to them. Citicard is now showing me in arrears for the {$1100.00} charge plus accumulated interest. Note that I always pay my credit card balances in full each month and have an excellent XXXX credit score. 
I subsequently cancelled my long-held Citicard ; yet, they still are showing me with an outstanding balance. Sincethe table was picked up by the vendor, a credit memo issued but not acted upon, why are they not crediting my account in full? It is impossible to receive an answer from Citicard other than " you have to deal with the vendor directly. '' Needless to say, the vendor -- XXXX XXXX -- does not respond either. 
If you want copies of the multiple letters and memos, I can furnish them.

Issue: Problem with a purchase shown on your statement
Sub-issue: Card was charged for something you did not purchase with the card
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/2020 a charge of XXXX from XXXX XXXX appeared as a pending charge to my Citi credit card account. I additionally received notice to contact Citi Fraud Department based on perceived fraudulent activity. I called immediately and was told the dispute process could not be started until the charge posted but that would happen automatically since I reported the charge as fraudulent. I did not make this charge and have no idea who did. 

On XX/XX/2020, the charge appeared as a posted charge for XXXX from XXXX XXXX with a charge date of XX/XX/2020. Additionally, a credit for XXXX appeared with a date of XX/XX/2020. Again, both of these are fraudulent. 

On XX/XX/2020, I contacted XXXX XXXX and a fraud investigation was started on their side as well. I was told the name on the airline ticket purchased with my card was not mine but they would not tell me who it was or where they were flying from/to. 

On XX/XX/2020, I additionally recontacted Citi fraud department as the charge and credit were still appearing in my account. The fraud department connected me to a second " specialist '' who told me the dispute would not show up in the " dispute center '' for at least 12 days and it could take 3 billing cycles to finish their investigation. I reminded him that the charge was made without my card present and I obviously had no idea who used it but they could very easily find out from XXXX whose name was on the ticket. He stated I was " liable for paying for the fraudulent charges '' until the investigation was complete. He refused to credit the account in the interim and when he transferred me to customer service, who he claimed would be able to do that, he told them I wanted a credit limit increase. The customer service rep told me she would have been able to credit the account if I had contacted prior to the end of the billing period. What?! I contacted the first 5 minutes after it showed up as a pending charge and I got the app message of a " card not present transaction. '' How much sooner would I need to contact?? 

I recognize investigations take time, however I should not be threatened with late fees and collections if I refuse to pay a charge that I have no liability for. I had a charge to my XXXX several years back and the charge was gone from my account before I hung up the phone. This is completely unacceptable.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Citi Double Cash Card - Denial of promotional offer after meeting eligibility requirement : XX/XX/XXXX - An application was submitted in citibank.com ( Application ID # XXXX ) applying for the Citi Double Cash Card with a promotional offer of {$150.00} to be credited to the account on the condition that {$500.00} is charged within the first 3 months after activation of the card.

XX/XX/XXXX - {$1000.00} is charged to the card. 

XX/XX/XXXX - I contacted the Citibank Customer Service team and was informed the promotional offer was not on my account. I was told I had to prove I used the correct link when applying. I explained I had no way of proving that and can not control that advertising links are correctly linked on their network. I filed a complaint to be internally reviewed and processed adamantly explaining the offer was on the citibank page when clicked. 

XX/XX/XXXX, Citibank sent a letter stating the account is not enrolled in the offer to receive the {$150.00} cash bank promotion and it states I did not apply using the correct link. 

XX/XX/XXXX - I called Customer Service again and was forwarded to a manager who explained I can file another complaint internally but would not get any different results. She explained Citibank would just mail me the same letter. 

I also wish to add that I have no credit card debt whatsoever along with a very high credit score, and am solely filing this complaint as a matter of principle. I feel defrauded entering into a contract with the promise of an award never realized. Consumers have no ability to control the advertising links on these offers as they are directed onto the Citibank network and are easily subject to fraud. Citibank makes no apology and shockingly asks consumers to provide information about their own network - clearly outside the control of the consumer.

I was a victim of identity theft. During the course of this fraud, several bank accounts and credit card accounts were compromised.

I once again contacted customer service, and was told within 3 business days this would be reversed : XXXX : Citi has gone ahead and taken care this for you!! 
XXXX : Be rest assured Citi is there for you and wont be satisfied until you are You : When will I see the {$500.00} charge removed and the {$25.00} transaction fee removed? 
XXXX : you can see once you receive the new card and there will be no transaction posted on the account!! you can surely save this chat as a proof and the account will be good to go. 

On XX/XX/2020, I checked the account and it was still showing a {$520.00} amount due. I contacted Citicards customer service and was told I needed to contact the fraud department. 

Both a fraud department representative from Citicards and a supervisor in the department told me that I would be required to pay the full amount and all associated fees. 

I believe this is potentially a violation of not only Citicards own terms and services, but of state and federal law. 

I asked them to issue a provisional credit immediately ( {$520.00} XXXX for the fraudulent charge, pending final review, and they said that it would not be possible and I needed to pay the full amount or have it go on my credit report as a late fee.

Consumer complaint narrative:
The attorney has engaged is unfair and deceptive practices in violation of FDCPA in his actions related to the attempted collection of a credit card debt which his firm bought from another agency. 
The debt is time barred, and as such can not be used as grounds for legal action. 
This attorney referenced an entry of judgement for which I was not aware nor properly notified nor properly served. 
In my attempt to resolve the debt in good faith, I provided financial information as a means to establishing a repayment plan. The attorney represented that they would cooperate with me in arriving at resolution. 
Instead, the attorney, without due notice levied my personal bank accounts. 
With the difficulty I have encountered in making contact with this attorney and his firm via phone, email, and correspondence via mail, I have not been given sufficient opportunity to communicate effectively nor has the attorney been forthright in their communication with me. 
My demand is that this attorney immediately be order to cease and desist all and any actions against me in the matter of collecting a debt, and be investigated by your office for disciplinary action.

Sub-issue: Funds not handled or disbursed as instructed
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/2020, I opened a new account with Citibank. Upon opening new account, banker then led me to branch teller to make my deposits. I handed teller sealed envelopes of my CASH deposit. She opened them in front of me then walked away out of sight for some time. I thought she would be right back with a bill counter. Instead she returned and handed me a deposit slip. I was confused because she did not count CASH in front of me ... but I was forced to leave because branch had just closed for the day. Later same day, I realize I am missing {$2200.00} from my cash deposit. 

I returned NEXT business day ( on XX/XX/XXXX ) and explained to banker ( who opened my new account ) what happened with teller/ my deposit. 

He didnt investigate the matter. Instead he brushed off the seriousness of her negligence. 

I asked him why teller walked away out of sight with a large sum of CASH? Why she didnt count it in front of me? And stated that Ive never seen this happen at any bank branch before. And how can I confirm she made a proper deposit? 

Banker replied that THIS BRANCH placed bill counters out of sight and DOES NOT COUNT CASH IN FRONT OF CUSTOMERS purposely. 

I recorded him admitting to this on my phone. 

I opened an investigation with CitiBank regarding my missing funds AND the negligence taking place at this branch. 

CITIBANK REFUSED to properly investigate this, never reached out for my evidence, closed the investigation citing deposit was correct because branch told them it was, and is REFUSING to honor my appeal! 

CITIBANK is supporting negligence and theft at this Branch by refusing to do a PROPER INVESTIGATION and by ignoring my appeal.

Sub-issue: Didn't receive notice of right to dispute
Consumer complaint narrative:
Good morning. 

The reason for this letter is to seek some help with three financial institutions with which I have been a client for years and so far I believe that they have treated my case unfairly. 

In XXXX, I became a father of XXXX  but unfortunately they were born in XXXX XXXX California at only XXXX XXXX XXXX, because they were XXXX XXXX we went through a lot of difficulties, even XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. I was in XXXX XXXX for almost 6 months while my XXXX XXXX girls were recovering so I had to move to XXXX XXXX so I could be with them in the hospital every day and make sure everything would be okay with them. As you can imagine what it means to leave your home, to find a place to stay in XXXX XXXX, to eat, etc., unfortunately the job I had couldn't keep my position and I had to quit within a month of asking for permission to be with my girls. From that moment on, my financial difficulties began, between medical expenses, rent, food, and credit card payments which I was able to make by taking money from my savings. And that is where I want to explain in detail why I feel it is unfair what has happened to me with three financial institutions. 

The first dispute I want to talk about is with Citi Bank, I have 2 cards with them and I have never been late on any payments, on the contrary, I was even paying off the debt in full. When I explained to them the situation I was going through and gave them all the information of why I was late in payments the only option they gave me was that I had to pay {$560.00} a month not to close the account, which I told them seemed like a lot of money at that time because I was coming back from XXXX XXXX and I explained my whole situation even sent letters from the hospital, but they didn't help me in any way. I made the greatest effort possible and paid {$560.00} for about three months, but I could not continue to pay that amount of money, I called again and asked to lower my monthly payment but there was no payment arrangement for more than I asked, I called several times and they did not give me any kind of help and closed the account which I am still paying, now {$220.00} per month because after they closed it was that they told me I could pay {$220.00}. This whole situation does not seem fair to me at all. I did everything possible to pay, I called to negotiate lower payments and they never helped me avoid closing my account. 

The second company with which I have to explain my dispute is XXXX, I had with them an XXXX   card, which I used very rarely and paid in full, but with them something very peculiar happened, as in my previous case I called to explain the situation that was happening, I made payments until I could from my savings to avoid late payments etc. I always made the payments through the application and never noticed anything out of place. After a few months, in XX/XX/XXXX, I realized that the account had been closed without any notice, even when I called repeatedly to explain the situation. The only way I realized that the account was closed was by logging into the desktop version since the application does not give any kind of notification or anything like that. I have called many times and asked to speak with a manager. They opened a case for me and still nobody wants to be responsible for the account being closed without any kind of notification, they did not even send me letters or statements informing me of the situation, not even a phone call. Three weeks ago I was able to talk to a manager and finally he was the only person who understood my case, he listened to me and he could see that in his system they had never sent me notifications that my account was closed, it was not until a few weeks ago that I received about 6 letters from XXXX informing me that the account was closed, do you think this is fair or valid for a client? That a person after having called countless times trying to solve this problem nobody listens to you or gives you an answer or takes your case seriously? I don't know what else I could do to get this account reopened because as I mentioned I was never notified that it was closed, I still make the payments on a monthly basis. 

The third company is XXXX XXXX, maybe I had a card with this company for years which I never used alone to settle some accounts but unfortunately they closed it and as in the other cases I exposed my case and still did not have any help.

I frequently called Citibank to get an update and see if more information was needed from me ( their call records will show this ). I could not speak with the disputes group investigating the matter and was later told it was not resolved in my favor because the merchant had shown I authorized the purchase. I did not receive the goods and services as described from XXXX XXXX XXXX. They have chosen not to respond to my questions after an attempt to resolve it with them. Consumer complaint narrative:
Starting in XX/XX/XXXX, I began disputing a XXXX XXXX/Citibank Credit Card account with the credit bureaus. This account was fraudulently opened using my personal information. The CRA 's immediately blocked this fraudulent account and provided all information to XXXX XXXXCitibank per my request. XXXX  XXXX/Citibank sent me a letter on XX/XX/XXXX confirming they were investigating everything, and on XX/XX/XXXX they sent another letter confirming their investigation was complete and they concluded I am still responsible for the account. No documentation was provided. 
On XX/XX/XXXX I received a letter from XXXX XXXX/Citibank, stating that my account was at risk of being referred to a collection agency. 

On XX/XX/XXXX I sent a letter to XXXX XXXX/Citibank requesting reinvestigation, and reiterated that I am a victim of identity theft and requested all specific records and documentation from their investigation pursuant to Section 609 ( e ) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act. I made sure to include all required documentation to support my claim for identity theft, including 1. A copy of my drivers license & social security card 2. A completed and signed FTC Identity Theft Report. 

XXXX  XXXX/Citibank wrote back on XX/XX/XXXX with the exact same letter as what was sent on XX/XX/XXXX. Absolutely zero changes made, and no further documentation was provided. 

As of XX/XX/XXXX, I received my first communication from a debt collection agency named XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. This agency made claim that the XXXX XXXX/Citibank credit card account was referred to them. 

The actions taken and NOT taken by XXXX XXXXCitibank are a serious violation of the law. As a victim of Identity theft the law clearly states that once the proper documentation was provided to XXXX XXXXCitibank they are NOT supposed to sell or charge off the account. They did it anyway. AND they failed to provide ANY documentation in any of their communications to me to substantiate their investigation. Instead they provided their insight on what they think really happened when they KNOW that is NOT what the law requires them to do.

She cancelled the order immediately. However when my bill arrived, I was charged for the washer and dryer. I went back to the home Depot store and explained to the customer service attendant that I cancelled the order before it shipped out. 

The agent told me not to worry and she took care of it right away and that I should disregard the billing amount. 

I received another bill the following month with a XXXX fee. I called customer service again to inquire about the mysterious charge. 

The customer service agent told me that the XXXX dollars fee is an investigation fee that the company charge in order to investigate the cancelled order. 

I am a senior and I feel that I am being scammed and treated very unfairly. I never received the order and I should not have to pay for the company to investigate a product that I cancelled prior to the items being shipped.

Consumer complaint narrative: Hi, I am XXXX XXXX from XXXX, Arizona. I want to direct your attention to this situation that I am dealing with my Citi Bank Best Buy credit card. I made a purchase for a laptop that was roughly {$700.00} in XXXX along with some previous balance. All these purchases were made with Best Buy 's promotional apr of 0 % interest for 12 to 18 months financing offers. I bought another product ( ~ {$350.00} ) with a similar offer later in XXXX. The company selected a minimum payment and I opted for autopay so that it will pay off my balance in the due time. The first purchase that I made for my laptop had a promotional offer until XX/XX/XXXX and in the monthly email that I received it only shows me a total balance of about {$1500.00}. They failed to notify me that my promotional period is ending and I have to pay whatever is left of the principal amount. In XXXX, they charged {$260.00} as interest and kept charging me about {$30.00} every month since then. I have been making their desired payment ( on autopay ) every month and I just realized my balance keeps increasing and it's more than {$2000.00} now. Essentially they are just taking the interest out of the account and keep stacking the principal. I was never informed by a rep that my promotional offer has ended and I need to pay a certain balance. After 6 months, I have been paying hundreds of dollars and it's mostly counting towards the interest and my due balance keeps increasing. They have not charged me for the other purchases yet as the promotions expire in XX/XX/XXXX. I have no idea where did all the payments I have made so far gone towards and why do I still owe them the total Principal in addition to the accrued interest. They are essentially making me pay {$700.00} ( principal ) +> {$400.00} ( interest ) +> {$800.00} ( other balance ) and I still don't know where did all the money go that I have paid them so far. I understand the numbers may add up for the company and they are charging me the interest accordingly but I was not notified of this at all. They just send you a total statement balance email and you're supposed to find the full statement and understand what is being paid off and what is not and I still can't understand what I have paid so far in the last two years of doing business with them. They certainly want to hide this information and make it even hard to understand for people. I have attached most of my statements from past two years and can provide more if needed. I even asked with a superior rep at Citi to resolve this but they are not willing to help me or negotiate with me to let me pay the principal. I just want to put this all behind me and pay what I really owe them honestly and get done with it. Please help me this is financial turmoil for somebody like me and I look towards for help.

On the XXXX of XXXX, 2020, at XXXX, I spoke with a Citi Bank credit card Supervisor- ID number either XXXX or XXXX, named XXXX. The topic of the call regarded my Citi bank double Cash personal Credit card, which carried a XXXX Balance. The card had closed down. It was brought to my attention that I had not made any purchases with the credit for 24 months. I received an email notification stating Action being required on XX/XX/XXXX. The email also mentioned that my account had been closed for the same reason ( dormant activity ). Within my online banking there Within the statement/documents section was only 1 Letter of closure was sent to me on the XXXX, stating the account was closed. XXXX said a letter was sent on XXXX 2020, by mail, informing me that the account had been closed. XXXX confirmed that zero letters were sent to me prior to the letter she claims was sent out XX/XX/2020. XXXX also mentioned the there was no timeframe to call back If I wanted to submit to reinstate my account to be reopened. Of course that meant running my credit again, which I shared no interest for. My consumer rights within the Citi bank policy grant me 2 letters of revert which state 2 letters will be sent to the customer, asking them to revert, if they wish, the account will remain open, to take action revert PRIOR to card closure. I was never sent a letter to revert in the mail. My address was current and clearly I never received and alerts of letters within my online banking nor any emails about the reverting of my account prior to closure. 
XXXX stated, she could not comment on the policies, when I read my rights, which were written by Citi Bank, to her. 

Here what I have an issue with : Error 1 ) they gave me 5 days from the XXXX, to address the account was closed on the ( 1st notification on the XXXX by email ) Error 2 ) I never received the 2 notification Letters prior to closing ( rule # 7 in document attached ) Error 3 ) XXXX stated I have any time to call back to reinstate which is false according to Citi Bank rules of 30 days. 

My credit score was negatively impacted once the Citi Bank with perfect payment history of 3 years, was closed.

Sub-issue: Problem with fees
Consumer complaint narrative:
I had the Citi American Airlines AAdvantage Executive Mastercard. The charge for the annual fee, in the amount of  {$450.00}, posted to my account on XX/XX/XXXX. On XX/XX/XXXX, I paid the balance of the statement, which was the charge for the annual fee. On XX/XX/XXXX, American Airlines closed all XXXX XXXX locations. This is the distinguishing benefit of this credit card. On XX/XX/XXXX, I contacted Citi to inquire about a credit to my account due to the XXXX XXXX closures. At that time, I was told by the representative that no credit was being offered. I was enticed to keep my card open, as there would be positive changes to be announced in the near future. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I read online that Citi would be offering a {$220.00} credit to card holders. However, there were two stipulations : 1. This applies to those who had an open account as of XX/XX/XXXX. 
2. The one-time {$220.00} credit will be issued when the account was renewed. 
This information was released on approximately XX/XX/XXXX. However, I did not receive an email from Citi, nor was there any form of communication by Citi to me. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I contacted Citi to ask for the {$220.00} credit to be applied, as my annual fee was applied in XXXX, two months prior. However, I was told this could not be done and that the credit would be applied in XX/XX/XXXX! There was nothing that they could do until next year. I feel that this is unacceptable. I had paid the annual fee in XXXX, and one of the primary benefits of the card is not accessible. And they would not be able to issue a credit to my account for 10 months!? I then told the Citi representative that I wished to cancel my credit card. However, no portion of my annual fee would be returned. There would not be a pro-rated refund. I am incredulous at this. Canceling my account on XX/XX/XXXX, means that for 9+ months, I will not be using this card. For Citi to keep the entirety of my annual fee is not just.

Please look into this issue and help me to resolve this matter.

Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Sub-issue: Debt was result of identity theft
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX, I received a billing statement form Citibank stating that there was a balance of {$5000.00}. According to them, this was the result of a balance transfer into a XXXX  XXXX XXXX account. I immediately went to a Citibank branch in my area and notified them that this account was not mine and somebody had opened it without my authorization, in other words, somebody had stolen my identity. The customer service representative at the Citibank branch looked into her system and told me that yes, somebody had opened a credit card line of credit under my name and address. At my insistence, they contacted the fraud/security department at Citibank to file a complaint. In a letter dated XX/XX/XXXX, Citibank stated that I had received benefits from a balance transfer to a valid account in my name at XXXX  XXXX XXXX. On XX/XX/XXXX, I downloaded a copy of my credit report from XXXX Credit Bureau. I noticed there were some errors with my personal information as well as 3 fraudulent bank accounts opened under my name ( Citibank, XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX ). On the same date, XX/XX/XXXX, I filed an Identity Theft Report with the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), reference # : XXXX. On XX/XX/XXXX, I contacted all 3 credit bureaus alerting them of the fraudulent accounts that appeared under my name. I requested that a fraud alert be placed on my credit reports as well as a credit freeze. On XX/XX/XXXX, I called the 3 banks where the fraudulent accounts had been opened. The representative from Citibank, stated once again that they would investigate my claim. The other 2 banks, XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX stated the same. On XX/XX/XXXX, I received a letter from Citibank ( dated XXXX XXXX ), that the account in question had been closed. They stated that in order to further investigate the fraudulent account, I would need to complete and sign a Statement of Fraudulent Application, which I did and returned to them on XX/XX/XXXX, via certified mail/return receipt. On XX/XX/XXXX, I filed an Identity Theft Report with the XXXX XXXX  XXXX Police Department, 70th Precinct in XXXX, N.Y. ( Police Report Number : XXXX ; case # : XXXX. The investigator assigned to this case, Detective XXXX, of the same Precinct. On that same date, XX/XX/XXXX, I submitted letters to the 3 credit bureaus as well as the banks where the accounts were opened fraudulently. I submitted supporting documentation ( the FTC Identity theft report as well as the complaint filed with the XXXX Police Department. On XX/XX/XXXX, I received letters from all 3 credit bureaus regarding my complaint for identity theft as well as the disputes I filed because of incorrect personal information on my credit reports as well as the fraudulent activities. The results were as follows : A ) XXXX Credit Bureau- a name that was not mine nor associated with me was deleted. They also deleted the incorrect apartment number which appeared in the report and added the correct one. XXXX also deleted the Citibank/Citicards as well as the XXXX XXXX XXXX fraudulent credit card accounts from my credit file. 
B ) XXXX Credit Bureau- They updated my personal information. They also deleted the Citibank/Citicards fraudulent account from my file as well as the XXXX account. They however, kept the XXXX  XXXX XXXX fraudulent account, claiming it was verified as accurate. 
C ) XXXX Credit Bureau- They also had the incorrect apartment number in the report. ( I wrote them a second letter and asked them to update their records with the correct information. They stated that the Citibank/Citicard fraudulent account was verified as belonging to me. They however, deleted the XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX fraudulent accounts from my credit file. 
On XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX I received a letter from XXXX XXXX XXXX . The letter states that after conducting their investigation, they found that : " we were unable to find eveidence that the tradeline displays on the bureau '' ; therefore, they do not hold me responsible for this account. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX I spoke with a representative from XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX She stated that they had received my letter along with supporting documentation on XX/XX/XXXX. She stated that the account had been closed, however, there was an open investigation into the account. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX I once again called the Fraud/Security Department at Citibank . I asked them why I continue to receive billing statements from them if this account had been closed because of fraudulent activity as per the letter from Citibank dated XX/XX/XXXX. They were dismissive and kept switching me from one customer service representative to the next. One of the customer service representative finally stated, they would investigate and would send me another copy of the Statement of Fraudulent Application. When I inquired as to why I had to submit another form if I had done so previously, she simply stated to complete it and send it back to them ( which I did ). 

On XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX Since I continued to receive billing statements from Citibank , I submitted a second letter, via certified mail/return receipt to Citibank , with supporting documentation about the fraudulent account. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX I received a letter from Citibank ( dated XX/XX/XXXX ), stating that they had completed their investigation and found that I was responsible for the account in question based on the following : " you received benefit from balance transfers to your XXXX XXXX XXXX account ''. They further state that they request the discontinuance of any further phone calls or written correspondence with them. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX I received a letter from XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX The letter states that after conducting a review of my claim, they state : " We wont hold you responsible for any transactions, interest charges or fees associated with this account. 

In summary, Citibank, has declined to accept that the account opened in their bank under my name was a product of fraud because according to them I received benefits from a transaction into a XXXX XXXX XXXX account. They have failed to understand that the XXXX XXXX XXXX account was also opened fraudulently as the bank, XXXX XXXX XXXX, acknowledges on their letter sent to me on XX/XX/XXXX. 
It is now XXXX and I see no resolution to this problem. Citibank does not want to hear any more of my claims and further, does not want me to call or write to them. 

I respectfully ask Citibank to close this account which now has a balance as of the XXXX Statement of {$7900.00}. I also request Citibank to cancel this account as it was opened fraudulently using my personal information. 
I hereby, seek the assistance of the Consumer Financial Bureau, to assist me in contacting Citibank and explaining to them what I have aforementioned. 
Thank you so much!

Consumer complaint narrative:
I lost my wallet or maybe it was stolen after watching XXXX night football and having drinks at XXXX XXXX XXXX. Because I had so much to drink I didnt notice until I woke up the next morning. When I called to order a new card they told me about a transaction where someone spent all of my money. So I disputed it because that was not me. I made the claim less than 48 hours from the transaction time and still was denied. The claim department has yet to honor me my money back. This just ruined my entire birthday and the holidays for me and I really need my money back. 

As I said I lost my wallet the night before and it had everything from my Id to atm receipts to my pin in it. I made that account online and was giving a automated pin, so to remember it I ripped just the four numbers out of the letter and kept it with me. I had too many drinks at XXXX XXXX XXXX and woke up hungover and noticed my entire wallet was gone. When I called I automatically was told my account balance after I provided my social security number to verify my identity. The automated message told me I had 3 dollars and some change which is not what I left in my account after making my last withdrawal. 

As said before I made a withdrawal on XXXX XXXX in the XXXX for XXXX $ the last thing I did with that card. I pulled {$80.00} and {$100.00} the 2 days before the XXXX $ withdrawal so I had some cash left plus the XXXX dollars when I went to watch XXXX night football at XXXX XXXX XXXX downtown XXXX. I dont remember the card numbers thats why its not provided in the beginning of this letter. When I found out about these transactions I disputed them furiously, I refuse to deposit any more money in that account until I receive my money back. I dont know if I misplaced the wallet at XXXX XXXX XXXX or the XXXX I just know I didnt have it when I woke up. I had to take off of work that day and everything because I woke up so late and hungover. When I asked where the transactions happened they told me something about XXXX and a post office at hours that I wasnt even awoke for. 

That was not me, citi is saying it is because it they used my pin. That does not make the transactions valid because I the owner of the card disputed them once I found out about them. I literally just put that money in there why would I spend it all at once like that when I have bills to pay. I told you guys the pin was in my wallet just the four numbers, because it wasnt a pin I created. I didnt have an online account yet to even change the pin and I didnt know how so I just dealt with it. 

I live in the XXXX, NY and I only used my card in the XXXX. Ive gone to XXXX XXXX plenty of times to do transactions that is the closest one to my home address. I have no ties to XXXX and its no way I couldve made those transactions if I was sleeping. I was not in XXXX the morning of XX/XX/XXXX idk if you guys want to ping my phone or what but I was at XXXX XXXX XXXX in apartment XXXX when those transactions were being made. That was not me XXXX XXXX, I am new to having a bank card I usually keep my cash but since I finally made a bank account I deposited with you guys. This is not how a new customer should be treated just because his account was recently opened i dont know what type of policy is that. 

I need my money back, how can you just let someone steal your customers money and tell him your not do anything about it. This is a bit ridiculous its been 2 denials and nothing is changing. I need my money back my entire birthday passed without my {$2000.00} and now its going on XXXX and you guys still havent refunded what was wrongfully stolen from me. I have bills and younger family members that receive gifts, yes I still get paychecks but that doesnt mean I dont need my XXXX XXXX. That was not me. Ive been going through this back and forth thing with you guys since I made this claim, Im not just going to let someone steal my money this is wrong. 

Claim # ; XXXX

Sub-issue: Problem during payment process
Consumer complaint narrative: We have a Home Depot Consumer credit card through Citi Bank. A few years ago I received a phone call about the card and they asked if I wanted to be set up for autopay and I did. XX/XX/XXXX I went on my Home Depot account online to pay the balance in full before the autopay was to come out on XX/XX/XXXX. The online balance on my account was {$730.00}, so I entered by new bank account information and paid it off. The phone autopay was set up to pay on our old bank account. On XX/XX/XXXX the autopay of {$28.00} was paid. On XX/XX/XXXX the payment was reversed because they tried to deduct it from the old bank account. I received an email XXXX XXXX that my Home Depot Statement was ready to view. Thinking this was odd since I had paid it off in XXXX and had not used the card I went to my online account and there was a balance of {$140.00}. I looked back to XXXX and saw my payment of XXXX and the XXXX payment and reversal. Looking at XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX statements we had been charged late fees, interest and processing fees from the XXXX reversal. I called Citi to find out what was going on because I had paid the balance in full online. We were told that the online balance on XX/XX/XXXX was minus the autopay of XXXX that was set to pay on XX/XX/XXXX. We explained that seemed very deceitful and asked that all of the fees and interest be reversed and we would gladly pay the XXXX that we owe. The customer service rep apologized but said there was nothing they could do. We asked to speak to her supervisor, who offered to waive one of the late fees leaving us with a balance of XXXX. We then asked to speak to executive manager. He proceeded to tell us this was normal practice. We argued that we were set up on autopay on many cards, which we paid off online with no problems at all, even another Citi Card. The only resolution we asked for was for them to back out the fees, get it off our credit report and we would pay the XXXX and they would not accommodate. They said they would escalate to their corporate office, but there was nothing they could do. They also have our current bank account information on their website since XXXX. Apparently their autopay set up by phone is completely different than autopay set up online. We communicated to them we would be in contact with our states Attorney General.

On XX/XX/2020, I received two separate emails from citi that my credit card limit had been lowered. I have two credit cards with this bank ( One email per card ). Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/XXXX - I took my vehicle to XXXX XXXX / XXXX XXXX XXXX for a transmission rebuild. 
XX/XX/XXXX - I paid XXXX {$500.00} as requested for the parts needed to start the job. Invoice was paid electronically via XXXX on my Citibank card. 
XX/XX/XXXX - XXXX provided me with updates on the removal and tear-down of the transmission. 
XX/XX/XXXX - I inquire about the progress via text. 
XX/XX/XXXX - I inquire about the progress via text. 
XX/XX/XXXX - XXXX responds that he needed to order a few extra parts and things will start moving along again in the coming week. 
XX/XX/XXXX - I inquire about the progress via text. 
XX/XX/XXXX - XXXX says he should have the vehicle back to me by the end of this coming week. 
XX/XX/XXXX - XXXX tells me he ran into an issue trying to find a particular bearing that is no longer available from the manufacturer ( discontinued part ). 
XX/XX/XXXX - I get a call from XXXX to discuss this discontinued part that is now holding up progress. 
XX/XX/XXXX - I locate an overseas reseller who has the part available. XXXX says he has ordered it. 
XX/XX/XXXX - I inquire about the progress via text. 
XX/XX/XXXX - XXXX says he has not seen the part arrive yet. 
XX/XX/XXXX - I ask XXXX if he has a tracking number for the part. 
XX/XX/XXXX - XXXX tells me that the part order never went through due to the method of payment he used. 
XX/XX/XXXX - I ordered the part myself from a seller in XXXX. Est. delivery of XX/XX/XXXX. 
XX/XX/XXXX - I text XXXX that the part should arrive soon and trying to arrange getting the part to him. No response from XXXX. 
XX/XX/XXXX - I text XXXX that the part should arrive soon and trying to arrange getting the part to him. No response from XXXX. 
XX/XX/XXXX - I text XXXX asking is he's received my texts. 
XX/XX/XXXX - I text XXXX asking what's going on? 
XX/XX/XXXX - XXXX responds, apologizing that he's been out of town and he will pick up the part from me in the next couple days. 
XX/XX/XXXX - I text XXXX asking that he call me. 
XX/XX/XXXX - I text XXXX asking that he call me. 
XX/XX/XXXX - I text XXXX again asking urgently that he contact me. 
XX/XX/XXXX - XXXX responds telling me he does intend to finish the job. 
XX/XX/XXXX - I text XXXX asking that he call me to discuss this and that I'm considering at this point just picking up my unfinished vehicle. 
XX/XX/XXXX - XXXX says he will call me this evening. 
XX/XX/XXXX - XXXX finally calls me and assures me that he is going to come by to pick up the part from me and finish the work on my car. Says he should have it done by the end of next week. 
XX/XX/XXXX - I text XXXX asking when he is coming by to pick up the part from me. 
XX/XX/XXXX - XXXX responds that he is " working on it '' XX/XX/XXXX - I text XXXX asking if he will be by today to pick up the part. 
XX/XX/XXXX - I text XXXX telling him that at this point that I would just like to arrange having my car picked up to take elsewhere. 
XX/XX/XXXX - I text XXXX again that I just want to pick up my car and parts I paid for. 
XX/XX/XXXX - XXXX texts me that he's been in LA getting medical testing and he will be back by the XX/XX/XXXX and get my car rolling so I can have it towed to another shop. 
XX/XX/XXXX - I text XXXX asking for a phone call. 
XX/XX/XXXX - XXXX texts me that he had to stay another day and he will be getting back on the XX/XX/XXXX or XX/XX/XXXX and will get my car back to me. 
XX/XX/XXXX - I text XXXX asking how it's looking on getting my car back today. 
XX/XX/XXXX - XXXX texts me saying that he's not quite back yet, but should have it ready for my by tomorrow morning. 
XX/XX/XXXX - I text XXXX and ask him how it's looking this morning. 
XX/XX/XXXX - XXXX says he is trying to find the clutch kit that he had ordered for me. 
XX/XX/XXXX - XXXX texts saying that couldn't find the clutch kit and may have to refund that portion to me. 
XX/XX/XXXX - XXXX texts saying that he is getting ready to head to the shop and get my car rolled out for me. 
XXXX rolls the car out for me and left before I could confront him. I find the car with the transmission in parts in the trunk, the engine is sagging in the engine bay by a single motor mount, steering components not connected. There are no new parts from a rebuild kit or clutch kit anywhere to be found. I get my car towed to another shop and after doing an inventory, they tell me there are internal components of the transmission that are missing. I am now looking at having to source another whole transmission in order to get my vehicle repaired. 

XX/XX/XXXX - I called Citibank to inquire about disputing the claim and was told that this falls outside of the time limitation allowed refund/chargeback.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/XXXX I was a victim of Fraud in which a tenant who was renting a property I own filed a FORGED DEED claiming he was the owner of the property with XXXX County. The tenant did so in order to avoid eviction after he fell months behind in rent. 
XX/XX/XXXX I filed suit against the individual who filed a Forged Deed and committed identity theft claiming ownership of my property at in XXXX Texas ( XXXX ) in the XXXX District Court of XXXX County. 
XX/XX/XXXX Multiple retained attorneys advise me and notify XXXX ( Mortgage Company ) of the pending lawsuit and forged deed. Additionally, I was advised to not make payments until the litigation was resolved as I stood a chance to lose not only the monies I had in the property but additionally any more monies I put in or paid off related to the property. 
XX/XX/XXXX Tenant moves to sell property with the FORGED DEED claiming title but XXXX XXXX who they were trying to use to close the property will not close as they find pending litigation on the property. Tenant then proceeds to find another Title company in XXXX Texas to do a remote closing a week or so later and the property is then sold by tenant to a new buyer through XXXX XXXX XXXX. Tenant falsely misrepresented to the title company that he is the owner and there is no litigation on the property ; the title company did not do their due diligence which resulted in the tenant proceeding to sign my name and use my SS # and other credentials thereby committing another case of forgery but this time an additional charge of identity theft. Proceeds of nearly $ 30,000+ were taken out and my outstanding mortgage loan on the property was paid in full by the buyer through the title company. Clean title was not given as litigation is still pending at XXXX County and set for trial in XX/XX/XXXX. The buyer was aware of this when they decided to take the risk and change to another title company after XXXX told them there was pending litigation and they would not close. 
o The judgement on this case should be in my favor due to the forgery committed that allowed all of this to happen. The property title will be corrected and the last clear chain of title when I purchased the property in XXXX will be recognized as true and correct. I will then move to evict the current occupant through the sheriffs office. That individual will then have to go to the title company and move to sue the tenant who has committed all of these crimes and I am not a party to that suit or any of the other suits involving the title company, mortgage company, etc. 
XX/XX/XXXX {$13000.00} payment made to CITI through CITI website to reduce utilization down to 30 % and improve credit score 40+ points in order to secure a HELOC to borrow against 350k+ Equity in my primary residence at and use that line to eliminate remaining revolving debts. 
XX/XX/XXXX CITI reduces my credit line by {$13000.00} on that account. I cancel additional payment of {$15000.00} on another CITI account and begin to seek answer from CITI on decreased credit line on the first account and what can be done to fix this issue. 
XX/XX/XXXX I speak with supervisor a CITI ( Kentucky location ) who advises me to cancel my payment through my bank to CITI as it has not posted as he tell me he is unable to cancel it on the CITI end. He then escalates the matter and sets up a call with Presidential Department ( CITI ) to discuss keeping my line of credit open and allowing me to explain why my credit score fell ( at no fault to me ) in hopes of keeping my credit line and repairing my credit given I have had 10+ years of flawless credit history with CITI . 
XX/XX/XXXX I call and speak with another representative who confirms I have a spot to be called by the Presidential Department. I ask if there are any locations I can do in and see a banker and there are none in Texas or surrounding states. We hang up with the understanding that I will receive a call to have the option to discuss my situation. 
XX/XX/XXXX Representative from CITI Presidential Department calls and leaves a voicemail. 
o I call back no answer, leave voicemail, proceed to call her 14 times and leave 2-3 voicemails over the next couple days with no call back. 
I call CITI and leave a message for them to have contact me. Citi Reference Number :  XXXX XX/XX/XXXX I receive a notification email that payment was returned unpaid. I knew this as this is what I was instructed to do by CITI employees on both XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX in order to discuss my options with the Presidential Department and potentially have the ability to my credit line. 
I log onto CITI website and see that something is wrong. I immediately see that both my CITI accounts have been closed. 
I contact CITI looking to speak with yet another American Supervisor as I still can not reach the Presidential Department. I speak with a gentleman with CITI in Arizona who informs me that because my account has been closed there is nothing he or I can do until I receive a letter in the mail explaining why my account was closed. He does tell me the credit line was reduced due to a credit pull but he thinks the line was closed due to the returned payment. 
o Mind you the returned payment was an additional payment as I had already paid another payment earlier in the Month. I have since made another payment for {$1000.00} and {$800.00} to each of my accounts with CITI. 
XX/XX/XXXX I call and finally get a chance to speak with Presidential Department ( had been trying to reach since Monday XXXX XXXX ) and she has to notify me that I no longer can make the request to keep my line and now have to make a request to reinstate my line. Asks me to resolve my credit dispute before doing so in hopes that she can restore my line after the dispute is corrected. 
o Problem : She doesnt realize the closing of my accounts maliciously and in bad taste by CITI will have more adverse effects on my credit. Likewise, the reason for doing so is due to someone fraudulently signing my name and forging documents in order to avoid eviction which had massive effects on my credit. 

In short : I have a whole lot more information if CFPB would like it. 
1. My attorney sent notice of pending lawsuit to XXXX ( Mortgagor who needs to fix false reporting ) 2. XXXX Responds with Modification to loan 1. Breakdown in Modification Docs ( I have these docs for CFPB, also sent to CITI ) 3. Modification Payment made in full ( overpaid ) 4. 2nd Modification Payment made in full ( overpaid ) 5.  My attorney requested for XXXX to become party to pending lawsuit related to title on and want for declaration of property be awarded to me. This would ensure their position of securing their security note by way of my deed. Remember, we are in litigation over forgery of a deed claiming I removed my interest in the property to the tenant. 
1. Another payment was not made as XXXX as they refused to join the suit and notify the court to have the property awarded to me which would secure their own note. They said they did not have an attorney and would let the court rule accordingly. Mind you, another payment was not due as I was overpaid on payments so I was not forgoing my payments just not making additional payment. 
2. Moreover, the mortgage company reported that I made no payments in XXXX through XXXX but the transaction but not only did I make payments but I made additional payment to fully cover all three of those payments. This is the issue we are having with XXXX on top of the litigation related to the suit on proper title. 
CITI did not even give me the opportunity to discuss and has caused further damage to my credit and ability to get out of this mess. I had a plan and they have destroyed that plan through being unethical and malicious.

Here are the details of what happened : My wife, XXXX XXXX, shopped in person at XXXX in XXXX, XXXX on or about XX/XX/2020. She purchased a childs dress for our granddaughter that cost {$29.00}. XXXX attempted to pay with her Citi Business card ending in XXXX but the merchant said that the charge would not go through. So XXXX had the merchant use XXXX XXXX XXXX card ending in XXXX and this charge successfully processed and is correct. Please see the attached document that shows this transaction with XXXX for {$29.00}. 
The childs dress for {$29.00} is the only item that XXXX purchased while shopping at XXXX. XXXX never returned to this merchant on another date and did not authorize any other charges. 
This merchant then processed a second unauthorized charge for {$200.00} dated XX/XX/2020. This one on the XXXX XXXX XXXX card and is the subject of another CFPB compliant ( Complaint ID : XXXX ) with XXXX. We did not receive any benefit for this transaction and then disputed the transaction with XXXX. 
We are unable to reach the merchant. The merchant is located in XXXX, XXXX and we live in XXXX IL USA so we have no way of contacting them. We have tried by email and have been unsuccessful obtaining a response. 

To summarize, XXXX did not authorize the {$130.00} disputed charge of the Citi Business Platinum Select Mastercard. We  did not receive any merchandise or service for this transaction. As explained earlier, the merchant swiped two credit cards on or about XX/XX/2020. First the Citi Business card ending in XXXX that the merchant said did not work, then XXXX XXXX XXXX ending in XXXX. A charge for {$29.00} was processed on the XXXX card that we do not dispute. The merchant somehow stored the card information to fraudulently charge unauthorized charges of {$200.00} on XX/XX/2020 on the XXXX card ending in XXXX, and also {$130.00} on XX/XX/2020 on the Citi Business Mastercard card ending in XXXX. The merchant is dishonest. 
We have purchased thousands of dollars worth of merchandize and services using the Citi Business Platinum Select Mastercard. We rarely dispute transactions and are disappointed that Citi decided to believe the merchant over us. 
We demand that the merchant be held accountable and that the {$130.00} charge be credited to our Citi Business card account promptly. We do not feel safe anymore using our credit cards in foreign countries since the Banks do not want to stand by and protect us from dishonest merchants.

Consumer complaint narrative:
We got the Citi Premier Card, which had a promotional offer ( XXXX reward points after spending {$4000.00} in the first 90 days ). 

WITHIN the first 90 days, we spent {$4000.00} and called Citi and spoke to a Citi Thank You Points representative, who represented and confirmed that we met the conditions to receive the XXXX reward points and that we would receive the XXXX point after the billing cycle was complete. In reliance of the Citi representative 's representations, we stopped using the card. 

AFTER the first 90 days was complete and the following billing cycle passed, we checked our account and did not receive the XXXX points. When we called Citi, the representative advised us of the complete opposite : that we didn't meet the conditions to receive the XXXX reward points. In fact, the Citi representative told us we didn't meet the conditions by {$8.00}. The Citi representative acknowledged the mistake by the last representative and told us to file a claim. We filed a claim over the telephone. 

We have called Citi multiple times and waited on hold for hours and hours to followup on the claim and have finally been verbally advised that the claim has been denied. We have been given no basis for the denial - and we keep getting the run around. In fact, on XX/XX/2020, after being on hold for 1.5 hours for three times, each time after the Citi representative purposely hangs up the phone - we still do not have any explanation for the denial nor any relief for the fact that a Citi representative told us we met all the conditions. 

I am astonished that a bank can make representations which are completely false and get away without giving its customer the rewards that they promise.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Good afternoon, I have an AAdvantage credit card, a MasterCard, with Citi Cards. 
I was recently given an increase to {$11000.00} as my credit limit. My previous limit was {$7500.00}. An increase of my credit limit by {$3500.00}. 
On my last statement, I was charged a {$40.00} late fee. I have contacted the customer service line at Citi ( XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) to contest this fee. Citi will not take the charge off despite being a good customer and having been given an increase in my credit limit. 
In XXXX, I made the XXXX payment - my minimum obligation to Citi - of {$220.00}. My check was dated XXXX and was received by Citi and credited to my account on XX/XX/XXXX. ( I live in XXXX and mail delivery is fast here. ) I made another payment to Citi on XX/XX/XXXX at the Citi banking machine ; it was received the same day, XX/XX/XXXX for {$220.00}. This extra XXXX payment was intended for XXXX - made early - because of my concerns about Covid 19 pandemic and getting my XXXX payment in. 
I was told that the second payment in XXXX was credited back to XXXX ; they could not credit that payment of {$220.00} for XXXX. 
I am still employed and working. That said, I made a payment on XX/XX/XXXX for {$220.00}. I mailed the payment on XX/XX/XXXX. Citi claims they received the payment on XX/XX/XXXX and sent an email thanking me for that payment. They also charged me the {$40.00} late fee. 
I think that {$40.00} is a lot for a late fee given that I had made a XXXX payment for XXXX. Also, even if Citi can't credit a XXXX payment to XXXX ( especially in these times ) then my XX/XX/XXXX payment should be credited on time. 
I do not understand why my payments to Citi have always been credited quickly and now it's taken Citi almost 15 days to credit my payment to my account. 
I explained to the Citi customer representative that I have been making payments ( 3 payments to Citi in XXXX and XXXX ) but that because Citi is working with a smaller crew, my payment was credited late. 
I sent my payment in ample time but believe that in-house delays at Citi ( smaller staff, working from home, etc. ) has caused the delay. This is not my fault that they credited the payment late. 
I would like my account to be credited the {$40.00} late fee because the delay was not my fault. 
Thank you. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX.

Sub-issue: Didn't receive terms that were advertised
Consumer complaint narrative:
I received targeted Citi advertisement for opening a new checking account that indicated I would receive a bonus of XXXX XXXX XXXX miles if I completed the following : 1. Open a new checking account in the Citi Priority Account Package by XX/XX/XXXX ; 2. Spend {$750.00} in purchases using my Citibank Debit Card within 60 days ; and 3. Make 1 qualifying bill payment for 2 consecutive months within the same 60-day period.

Based on this advertised information, I proceeded to open a new checking account and began making purchases with it as of XX/XX/XXXX. I then met the requirement to spend {$750.00} dollars using my debit card and made 2 consecutive months of bill payments for my electricity bill. Then, over the course of the next few months, I contacted Citi about the pending bonus. In my communication via chat/messaging with Citi, I was informed on three separate occasions that I had met all the requirements but simply needed to wait for my bonus miles to post. Yet, the bonus had not posted after significant time passed. So, I contacted Citi for the fourth time to inquire about it and this was when I was informed that previous representatives had misinformed me - I did not in fact meet all the qualifications because the 2 consecutive months of bill payments that I made did not qualify since they were not made directly form the Citi website or mobile app. 

Citi 's practices and communication in this regard are unfair and deceptive per the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act of 2010. They are unfair because they resulted in substantial harm by withholding XXXX XXXX XXXX miles that was not reasonably avoidable. They are deceptive because material terms regarding the account were misrepresented initially and after account opening.

Sub-issue: Problem during payment process
Consumer complaint narrative:
I have an account with Home Depot. I had a revolving balance and three promotional balances that were do at different times. On New Years eve I went to my local Home Depot to pay off my revolving balance so no further interest would accrue, and pay towards my XXXX promotional balance. The woman at the customer service counter was unfamiliar with how to do this, so she contacted the national Home Depot credit services department. After speaking with someone there, she passed the phone to me. It was explained to me that because I had a promotional balance due in XXXX, they couldnt pay off the revolving balance first. I complained that XXXX was two months away and that balance was to be paid off by the. The customer service rep told me that their computers would not allow them to divide payments this way. 
In XXXX, when the bill came due I paid off the amount of the remaining revolving balance + extra so it would lessen the XXXX promotional balance. 
When I received my XXXX bill. There was an interest charge of {$10.00}. I called customer service on XX/XX/2020 @ XXXX pm and spoke with XXXX. I explained I was disputing the interest charge due to the fact that I was not allowed by their company to pay off my revolving balance in full the previous month. She spoke to a supervisor who said that they would redirect {$670.00} of my payment of {$790.00} to pay off the revolving balance and remove the {$10.00} interest charge. At that point I was satisfied. 
However, on XXXX XXXX I again called Home Depot Credit Services to verify that all the aforementioned had occurred before I made my XXXX payment. I spoke to XXXX who took a lot of time with me. However, other than removing the interest charge, nothing had changed. I still had a revolving balance, the promotional balance due in XXXX and the one due in XXXX. I explained about the previous conversation I had had with XXXX and what her supervisor had said. She put me on hold, and spoke to someone and was told the same spiel about how because there were 30 days left until the XXXX promotional balance was due, they couldnt pay off the revolving balance first, but instead had to divide up the payment. She apologized, but said there was nothing she could do. I asked what amount I needed to make so I wouldnt accrue interest and could pay off the revolving balance. It seemed the only way to do this was pay the amount of the revolving balance, the total remaining on the XXXX promotional balance, and the XXXX promotional balance. So I did. 
This is a ridiculous scam! If a promotional balance is due on say XX/XX/XXXX, and you pay it off before XX/XX/XXXX, the company should not be allowed to redirect payment from one balance to another. This is just their way of collecting interest. By not allowing me to pay off my revolving balance first, they guaranteed they would continue collecting interest every month. This is a dishonest and disgusting practice that sours me on this company!

Consumer complaint narrative:
( 1 ) Citibank is NOT fulfilling the terms of their promotion for new Citi XXXX XXXX Platinum Select Mastercard accounts. On XX/XX/XXXX, in response to a promotional invitation from XXXX XXXX, I applied for a Citi XXXX XXXX Platinum Select Mastercard. The terms of the promotional invitation ( see XXXX ) were that if I spent {$3000.00} on the Citi XXXX XXXX Platinum Select Mastercard within 3 months, I would receive XXXX XXXX XXXX miles. By XX/XX/XXXX ( see credit card statement XXXX ), less than 1.5 months after being approved for the credit card, I had spent {$3300.00} on my Citi XXXX XXXX Platinum Select Mastercard.

As of now ( more than 4 months after I finished spending {$3000.00} on my Citi credit card ), I still have not received my XXXX XXXX XXXX miles. 

( 2 ) After many phone calls and live chats with Citi, I received two letters from Citi dated XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX ( see XXXX and XXXX ). Both letters informed me that " XXXX XXXX AAdvantage bonus miles are not available if you have received a new account bonus for a Citi / AAdvantage Platinum Select account in the past 48 months. '' This was the reason why I had not received my XXXX bonus XXXX XXXX miles. 

( 3 ) I am filing this complaint because the terms and conditions of _my_ Citi XXXX XXXX Platinum Select credit card application explicitly did NOT include the language that " XXXX XXXX AAdvantage bonus miles are not available if you have received a new account bonus for a Citi / AAdvantage Platinum Select account in the past 48 months. '' In fact, the major difference between _my_ Citi XXXX XXXX Platinum Select credit card application ( see XXXX ) and the _standard_ Citi XXXX Airlines application ( see XXXX ) is that the 48 month restriction for bonus XXXX XXXX miles appears only on the _standard_ Citi XXXX XXXX   application. In the _standard_ Citi XXXX XXXX application ( see  XXXX ), the second line under the title ( " Citi / AAdvantage Platinum Select World Elite Mastercard '' ) explicitly contains the words : " XXXX XXXX AAdvantage bonus miles are not available if you have received a new account bonus for a Citi / AAdvantage Platinum Select account in the past 48 months. '' However, _my_ application for the Citi XXXX XXXX Platinum Select Mastercard ( see XXXX ), explicitly contains no language anywhere about the 48 month restriction on bonus miles. Unlike the _standard_ application ( see XXXX ) for the Citi XXXX XXXX  Platinum Select Mastercard , the lines under the title ( " Citi / AAdvantage Platinum Select World Elite Mastercard '' ) on _my_ application ( see  XXXX ) make no mention of the 48 month restriction on bonus XXXX XXXX  miles. In fact, this 48 month restriction on bonus miles does not appear _anywhere_ on _my_ Citi credit card application ( XXXX ). 

Thus, the 48 month restriction on bonus XXXX XXXX miles is irrelevant, because it did not appear anywhere on _my_ Citi credit card application ( XXXX ).  Citibank must honor the terms and conditions of _my_ Citi credit card application. 

( 4 ) Since I have fulfilled the terms and conditions of _my_ Citi  XXXX XXXX Platinum Select credit card application , Citibank must credit my XXXX XXXX frequent flier account  with XXXX XXXX XXXX  miles .
